A Home in Every Port+.name: A Home in Every Port+
A Home in Every Port+.description:
You have a reputation in towns and villages you've visited, and residents are always willing to open their doors to you.

When in a town or village, during downtime, you can spend 8 hours to locate a resident willing to provide lodging for you and up to six allies for up to 24 hours at no charge. The standard of living within the acquired lodging is comfortable, and square meals are provided at no cost.

After 24 hours, you must pay standard prices for further lodging and meals or use this feat again to find a new resident willing to host you.

Abrupt Dismissal.name: Abrupt Dismissal
Abrupt Dismissal.description:
Trigger Your turn begins.

You are able to end the effects of spells and similar abilities with nary a thought. You Dismiss an active effect.

Adapted Camouflage.name: Adapted Camouflage
Adapted Camouflage.description: You have learned to gather items from your local surroundings, making it easier to blend in with your surroundings. You can spend 10 minutes gathering nearby materials to help you hide in certain terrains and add flora and other materials to make yourself harder to spot. When you do, you can use Survival to [[/act avoid-notice skill=survival]] instead of Stealth for as long as you use that activity within the required terrain and to initiative if you would enter an encounter while using Avoid Notice in this way. Your adapted camouflage lasts for [[/r 1d4 #Hours]] hours or until you enter an encounter, whichever comes first. You can choose to use Stealth instead of Survival for your Avoid Notice when using your adapted camouflage, and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check if you do.

Affliction Mithridatism.name: Affliction Mithridatism
Affliction Mithridatism.description:
You practice taking small amounts of harmful agents in order to resist them. Each day during your daily preparations, you can expose yourself to a disease or inflict yourself with a poison, usually through the remains of a creature that imposes the affliction. Attempt a @Check[type:medicine] check against the affliction's DC.

Critical Success You become immune to the affliction in question for 8 hours.

Success You gain a +4 circumstance bonus to saves against the affliction for the next 8 hours. Alternatively, you can choose to instead gain resistance equal to your level against damage the chosen poison or affliction would deal.

Failure There is no effect.

Critical Failure You must immediately save against the disease or poison, as if you were afflicted.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.fS9pFotZMFXpi1G2]{Effect: Affliction Mithridatism}

All Hands on Deck!.name: All Hands on Deck!

prerequisites.value: expert in Fishing Lore, Ocean Lore, or Sailing Lore

All Hands on Deck!.description: You travel the waves with a hardy crew. When you're piloting a vehicle or aboard a vehicle that uses Sailing Lore to be piloted, it needs 1 fewer crew member to operate (minimum 0). This increases to 2 fewer crew members if you're a master in the prerequisite Lore, or 4 if you're legendary. Alternatively, you can choose to grant a circumstance bonus to checks to pilot the vehicle equal to the reduced crew member count you would have provided the vehicle.

All In A Day's Work.name: All In A Day's Work
All In A Day's Work.description: You feel invigorated whenever you spend some time farming. If you successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} using Farming Lore, you gain a +1 status against emotion effects for 1 day.

Allied Diversion.name: Allied Diversion
Allied Diversion.description: You can help divert attention away from your allies with your astounding tricks. You use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion} except instead of the normal effects for your Create a Diversion, you can choose up to 10 allied creatures within 30 feet of you. The chosen allies become hidden from your Create a Diversion instead of yourself until the beginning of your next turn. Regardless of the result, creatures you use Allied Diversion against are temporarily immune to your Allied Diversion for 1 hour.

Aquatic Spellcaster.name: Aquatic Spellcaster
Aquatic Spellcaster.description: You've developed a means to cast spells while underwater, expelling as little air as possible when speaking the necessary spell incantations aloud. When you Cast a Spell underwater, you do not lose all remaining air if it would require speech but instead lose 2 rounds of air as normal for taking actions while holding your breath. Additionally, ranged spell attacks that deal piercing damage do not have their range halved while underwater.

Arcane Craftmanship.name: Arcane Craftmanship
Arcane Craftmanship.description: Your skill with creating arcane magical items surpasses your peers, wielding a boundless knowledge of magical items to perfect your craft, scribing scrolls and creating magical staves for personal use. You can Craft magical items with the arcane trait, and when you attempt to Craft a magical item with the arcane trait, you can roll Arcana instead of Crafting. If you use Arcana to Craft, you use your proficiency in Arcana instead of Crafting to determine what level items you can Craft.

Arcane Ward.name: Arcane Ward
Arcane Ward.description: You create a minor magical ward over yourself or an ally to protect themselves from harmful magic. During your daily preparations, pick 1 creature to imbue a ward upon and specify one of the following traits: acid, air, cold, earth, electricity, fire, force, mental, metal, water, or wood. If you are at least legendary in Arcana, you can pick 2 creatures instead of 1. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.xbNr7SNbVp9X1KGQ]{Warding Protection} reaction.

Armor Assist+.name: Armor Assist+

prerequisites.value: trained in Athletics or Warfare Lore

Armor Assist+.description:
After your service aiding armored combatants, you are practiced in helping yourself and others don heavy gear.

In addition, when you don armor, you can attempt an Athletics or Warfare Lore check with a DC determined by the GM (but usually 15 for common armor, DC 20 for uncommon armor, and DC 25 for rare armor). If you succeed at your check, your armor gains the comfort trait until you remove your armor or 1 day has passed. After 1 day, you must remove your armor for at least 1 hour before donning your armor again to alleviate any discomfort from wearing your armor for too long.

You can attempt an Athletics or Warfare Lore check with a DC determined by the GM (but usually 15 for common armor, DC 20 for uncommon armor, and DC 25 for rare armor) to halve the time you take to don armor.

You can halve an ally's time to don armor by working with them to don the armor and succeeding at an Athletics or Warfare Lore check against the same DC.

Armored Comfort.name: Armored Comfort
Armored Comfort.description: You know how to adjust your armor to get the most out of it while mitigating the downsides. You treat an armor's bulk as 1 lower while donned. When wearing armor that would give you an armor check penalty and you do not meet the Strength threshold required, you reduce the check penalty to skill checks by 2.

Artist of Repute.name: Artist of Repute
Artist of Repute.description: Your fame compounds with each of your performances, helping you earn more than a usual performer usually would. Whenever you critically succeed on a Performance check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, you gain a level of notoriety in the current settlement or location you reside in. The next time you use Performance to Earn Income in the same settlement, you treat the task level of your Earn Income as one higher for the purposes of what currency you receive. If you are a master in Performance, you treat the task level as 2 higher, and if you are legendary in Performance you treat the task level as 4 higher.

Artistic Craftsperson.name: Artistic Craftsperson
Artistic Craftsperson.description:
You know how to create and repair items that you often handle during your performances. You can use Performance in place of Crafting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} instruments, props, tools, or more that are essential for methods of Performance and you are always treated as having the formula for these items. If you use Performance to Craft, your Performance proficiency is used for determining what level items you can craft as though it were the Crafting skill.

In addition, you can also use your proficiency in Performance to Repair these items and to determine how many Hit Points you restore when you use Repair on these items.

Special If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.lFwfUvH2708rl6i3]{Virtuosic Performer}, you can apply your bonus from Virtuosic Performer to the Craft and Repair actions for these items.

As In Fairytales.name: As In Fairytales
As In Fairytales.description:
Frequency Once per day

Fate has rules, and they are the rules of a satisfying story—and you know the actions any character must take will ultimately lead to a happily ever after for you. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{Perform}, and compare your result against the Will DC of a creature within 30 feet. You can choose to dictate the outcome of the next action or activity taken by a creature within 30 feet so that their next skill check or attack roll is a success if it would be a failure or failure if it would be a success as you weave the story of what happens. The action gains the fortune trait if you would improve the results to a success or the misfortune trait if it would be worsened into a failure.

Assess Terrain.name: Assess Terrain
Assess Terrain.description:
You assess the current terrain you are in, and then adapt yourself to your surroundings. Choose a @Template[type:burst|distance:5] area within 30 feet of you that contains natural difficult terrain and attempt a @Check[survival|dc:15] check. The difficult terrain must be natural terrain and you must be able to clearly perceive the area. If you are an expert in Survival, you can increase the DC to 20 (@Check[survival|dc:20]) to assess a @Template[type:burst|distance:10]. If you are a master in Survival, you can increase the DC to 30 (@Check[survival|dc:30]) to assess a @Template[type:burst|distance:20]. And if you are legendary in Survival, you can increase these DCs by 10 to use this ability on difficult terrain created by effects with the cold, earth, plant, water, or wood traits in addition to natural terrain.

Critical Success You treat the difficult terrain as normal terrain for up to 1 minute and greater difficult terrain as difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

Success You treat the difficult terrain as normal terrain until the end of your next turn.

Critical Failure You misjudge the terrain, and you treat the entire area as difficult terrain or greater difficult terrain if the area was already difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

Astrological Divination.name: Astrological Divination
Astrological Divination.description:
Frequency Once per day

Through the interpretation of the constellations in the sky, you divine the future and make informed guesses. You can spend 1 hour performing an astrological reading to gain knowledge of a specific event by making an @Check[occultism|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level. If you have access to a clear night sky where you can see the stars or other methods for reading the stars, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check.

Critical Success You perform reading with regards to the event, producing the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]. You predict the results of this event up to 1 day into the future instead of the normal duration.

Success As critical success, except you predict results of this event up to 12 hours into the future instead of the normal duration.

Audacious Pilfer.name: Audacious Pilfer
Audacious Pilfer.description: You don't even bother to hide certain thefts, instead loudly and flashily doing so with reckless abandon. When you take the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} action, you may roll against a target's Reflex DC instead of their Perception DC, but if you do, your theft is known by the target and creatures nearby whether you succeed or fail at your check.

Awesome Flex.name: Awesome Flex
Awesome Flex.description: By showing off your incredible musculature, you can briefly cause creatures who revere strength to marvel at you. When a creature witnesses you successfully make an Athletics check against a standard DC of their level or higher, you can immediately attempt another [[/act make-an-impression skill=athletics]]{Athletics} check to Make an Impression against that creature so long as you have not taken a hostile action against them or their allies. If the creature you target would not normally be impressed by a show of strength, such as an academic, treat your degree of success as one worse. If you are legendary in Athletics, you can target up to 10 creatures without penalty with this Make an Impression.

Back Off!.name: Back Off!
Back Off!.description:
Trigger A creature moves to be within 15 feet of you.

For some enemies, being in your vicinity in itself is a source of fear. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature.

Bared Fangs in the Shadows.name: Bared Fangs in the Shadows
Bared Fangs in the Shadows.description:
You slink around while looking daggers at a creature, akin to a beast eyeing its prey. You can choose a creature you're aware of when you Hide or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. If you do, the GM rolls a secret Intimidation check for you to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} the creature into silence if they notice you, and on a success, they will not reveal you.

Additionally, if you successfully Coerce the creature, you become aware that they noticed you as you watch their expression turn shocked or fearful. They may still reveal they noticed you after 1 minute has passed or you are revealed by another creature (such as with the Point Out action).

Bastion of Knowledge.name: Bastion of Knowledge
Bastion of Knowledge.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

You serve as an inspiration for all to learn all they can. You attempt to Recall Knowledge. If you succeed, you become surrounded by a teacher's aura in a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] for 1 minute. Allies within the aura gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.UN7IXaYjVOhxOh1T]{Bastion's Guidance} reaction.

Beast Tamer.name: Beast Tamer
Beast Tamer.description:
You are a friend to all beasts and animals, able to find kinship in them and command them as you see fit, and they will listen. You automatically succeed on checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal} on animals lower level than you so long as their attitude toward you is indifferent or better. When you Command an Animal you do not control, you can give them specific commands as though you were directing an animal companion.

In addition, you do not automatically fail checks to Command an Animal that is unfriendly or hostile to you, but instead take a -4 circumstance penalty and if you succeed, the animal refuses to take hostile actions against you or your allies for 1 hour unless you or your allies take a hostile action against the animal or its allies.

Befuddling Illusions.name: Befuddling Illusions
Befuddling Illusions.description:
Through the usage of minor illusions and mind-altering magic, you can deceive your foes in the heat of combat. You can roll Occultism or Arcana instead of Deception to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}, if you do, you add the Concentrate, Manipulate, and Magical traits to the action.

[[/act create-a-diversion variant=trick skill=occultism traits=concentrate,manipulate,magical]]

[[/act create-a-diversion variant=trick skill=arcana traits=concentrate,manipulate,magical]]

prerequisites.value: You have been blessed by an archon or you wield an ancient treasure of heaven

Behold!.name: Behold!
Behold!.description:
Seraphic power channels into you, allowing you to express your soul visually. You expel a fiery display of eyes, swords and wings as if you yourself were an archon. All creatures within 30 feet who can see you must make a @Check[will|against:class-spell] save against your class DC or spell DC, whichever is higher. If the creature has the unholy trait, this effect loses the incapacitation trait. Regardless of the result, the creatures are then immune for 1 minute.

Success The creature is unaffected.

Failure The creature bows in awe and becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}. If the creature has the unholy trait, it is also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure As failure, except the creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} if it had the unholy trait.

Bend Iron, Crush Stone.name: Bend Iron, Crush Stone
Bend Iron, Crush Stone.description:
To your awesome strength, a metal bar is nothing but a cheap plaything. Your unarmed attacks against unattended objects and structures ignore an amount of Hardness equal to half your Athletics proficiency bonus ([[/r floor((@actor.system.skills.athletics.rank * 2 + @actor.level) /2)]]) when you make unarmed Strikes against them and you can always choose to deal your level in damage when you successfully use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SjmKHgI7a5Z9JzBx]{Force Open} against structures.

In addition, you can Force Open or make an unarmed Strike as a 3-action activity to deal damage to unattended objects or structures, dealing thrice the damage you would normally deal from the chosen action against the object or structure in question.

Beseech Fate.name: Beseech Fate
Beseech Fate.description:
Frequency Once per day

You plead with such fervor that you somehow warp reality to protect you or an ally. You attempt to suppress the clumsy, enfeebled, frightened, sickened, or stupefied condition from yourself or another creature within 30 feet by attempting a Diplomacy check against the DC of the effect that caused the condition or a hard DC of the target creature's level, whichever is higher. The GM may modify the DC according to the circumstance, such as whether you might be praying to a deity from within the deity's shrine. If the condition has a duration longer than 1 minute, the condition resumes after 1 minute has passed, but the time it spent suppressed counts towards reducing the duration.

Blink of an Eye.name: Blink of an Eye
Blink of an Eye.description:
Trigger You would be subject to a visual effect that would require you to look at a creature or object.

You turn away in the blink of an eye. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UWdRX1VelipCzrCg]{Avert Gaze}.

Breath Taker.name: Breath Taker
Breath Taker.description:
Creatures instinctively stop breathing from the fright you gave them. If you successfully Demoralize a creature that needs to breathe, the creature gasps, letting go of any breath they were holding and taking a -1 circumstance penalty to inhaled or olfactory effects for 1 round. If a creature cannot normally breathe in the environment they are in, such as if they are underwater, the number of rounds they can hold their breath is halved instead of the normal effects.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.yoXxQL01V0fI4skD]{Effect: Breath Taker}

Breathing Techniques.name: Breathing Techniques
Breathing Techniques.description:
You have learned to extend the capacity of your lungs using a measured technique of intense breaths. Make a Survival check in an attempt to increase the number of rounds you can hold your breath the next time you do so in the next 10 minutes according to the table below. After you have used Breathing Techniques, you lose only 1 round of air at the end of your turn while holding your breath if you attack or Cast a Spell instead of 2.

The @Check[survival|dc:15|showDC:none] check DC is usually 15, though the GM might adjust it based on the circumstances, such as being in a confined space or holding your breath while swimming in sewage. If you're an expert in Survival, you can instead attempt a DC 20 check to increase the rounds gained; if you're a master of Survival, you can instead attempt a @Check[survival|dc:30|showDC:none]{DC 30} check to increase the rounds gained further; and if you're legendary, you can instead attempt a @Check[survival|dc:40|showDC:none]{DC 40} check to increase the rounds gained even further.

Butterflies, Be Gone!.name: Butterflies, Be Gone!
Butterflies, Be Gone!.description:
Requirements You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18].

Instead of retching, you can remove your sickened condition by taking a deep breath to recenter yourself. Make a Performance check against the DC of the effect that made you sickened. On a success, you reduce your sickened value by 1 (or by 2 on a critical success).

Can't Stop, Won't Stop.name: Can't Stop, Won't Stop
Can't Stop, Won't Stop.description:
Trigger You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2]{Wounded} condition or increase the value of your wounded condition.

Returning back from death doesn't frighten you, it reminds you of being alive. You gain a status bonus to a save of your choice equal to the value of your wounded condition. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.g92q06HvQQvyj445]{Still Standing} bold reaction.

Careful Watch.name: Careful Watch

prerequisites.value: expert in a Lore related to a terrain type

Careful Watch.description:
Requirements You are in the terrain associated with your related Lore.

You are aware of the dangers of your familiar terrain. Whenever you spend at least 10 minutes setting up a watch area in a @Template[type:burst|distance:30] within the required terrain, creatures must succeed at a second Stealth check against your Lore DC in addition to your Perception DC or they become detected as if they failed against your Perception DC. If you detect a creature with your Lore DC, you can roll initiative using the required Lore with a +2 circumstance bonus. This effect remains until you leave the area or 1 day has passed, whichever comes first.

Careful Withdrawal.name: Careful Withdrawal
Careful Withdrawal.description:
Requirements You are within an enemy's melee reach and are wielding a shield or a weapon with the parry trait.

You have learned how best to withdraw from a dangerous situation. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield} or Parry then Step away from the required enemy and Stride. If your Stride would trigger a reaction from the required enemy, you double the circumstance bonus from your shield or parry against Strikes it makes against you as part of that reaction.

Castling Crashers.description:
Requirements You are within 60 feet of your partner.

You and your partner are quick on your feet, unexpectedly repositioning like king and rook on a chessboard. While employing this teamwork, when you or your partner Strides towards the other, you each gain a +10 circumstance bonus to their Speed for this Stride, but must end the Stride as close to the other as possible. You also each gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.2XWMN181rq3h8K5j]{Crash Together} reaction.
Castling Crashers.name: Castling Crashers

Chase Shortcut.name: Chase Shortcut
Chase Shortcut.description:
Trigger You fail a check in a chase.

Requirements You are in the location associated with your related Lore.

You navigate a chase in your home territory with ease, taking a shortcut when things don't go according to plan. You can reroll the triggering skill check using the required Lore instead of the normal skill, taking the new result even if it is worse.

prerequisites.value: expert in a Lore related to a settlement or region

Churning Fear.name: Churning Fear
Churning Fear.description: You feed the fear of a target, possibly making them ill at ease. When you critically succeed at a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} against a creature, they become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened 1}.

Circadian Disciplinarian.name: Circadian Disciplinarian
Circadian Disciplinarian.description:
You have learned to reset your body in a shorter amount of time. You can spend 1 hour resting to gain some of the effects from a full night's rest by making a @Check[survival|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level. If you have spent more than 1 day without a full night's rest, you automatically fail this check. You still cannot gain the effects from resting more than once in 24 hours, but you gain any effects that you did not gain from resting in this way if you rest for 8 hours (such as regaining your spells). If you are a master in Survival, you can rest for 10 minutes instead of 1 hour to gain the listed effects.

Critical Success You lose the fatigued condition, reduce your drained condition by 1, and regain Hit Points equal to your Constitution modifier (minimum 1) multiplied by your level.

Success As critical success, except the amount of Hit Points you regain is halved.

Clever Cheat.name: Clever Cheat

prerequisites.value: trained in Games Lore or Gambling Lore

Clever Cheat.description:
You are such an experienced swindler and cheater, you don't even need to use counterfeit decks or other cheater's tools. When playing games or gambling, you may choose to cheat if you are not using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.6NEOf1UznG4Po0Qi]{Loaded Dice} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.Q4KkKGGXq4bNGHh2]{Marked Playing Cards} by deftly manipulating the tools of the game to your advantage. If you do so, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Games Lore or Gambling Lore checks made for the duration of the game you are playing.

To discern if you are cheating, an observer must also succeed at a Perception check against your Games Lore or Gambling Lore DC in addition to any other checks to detect your cheating. If you are a master in Games Lore or Gambling Lore, the circumstance bonus increases to +2.

Clean Entry.name: Clean Entry
Clean Entry.description: You slip through even the most closely guarded entrances. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. As part of your Sneak, you can Interact up to two times to open or close doors, move obstacles, or similar actions. Interacting this way does not make you observed, and you take care to manipulate doors as quietly as possible, but creatures watching the doors might see them open or close, even if they do not notice you specifically. You can choose to Stride or Leap instead of Sneaking, or Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead if you have the corresponding movement type.

Cold Reading.name: Cold Reading
Cold Reading.description: Being a practitioner of cold reading, you occasionally call upon fortune-telling techniques that associate physical traits, life details, and other omens surrounding them. If you spend 1 minute in conversation with someone and observing them, you may ask one question in which the GM may roll a secret Occultism check in place of Perception to [[/act sense-motive skill=occultism]] in order to discover underlying aspects of the individual's personality or behaviors. If you are a master in Occultism you may ask 2 questions over the course of 3 minutes. If you are legendary in Occultism, you may ask 3 questions over the course of 5 minutes. This cannot be used to tell if someone is lying to you directly about their answers, only about their underlying emotional and mental state. Regardless of the result, targets of your Cold Reading are temporarily immune for 1 day.

Comfortable Terrain.description:
Requirements You are in the terrain associated with your related Lore.

You find yourself more at ease and recover faster when you are in an environment you are familiar with. You double the amount of Hit Points you recover from Resting while in your terrain. If you are afflicted with a disease or poison that is common within your terrain, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Treat Poison} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease} using the required Lore instead of Medicine and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check. If you are afflicted with a disease, you can attempt to Treat Disease as part of Resting within your terrain.

prerequisites.value: master in a Lore related to a terrain type

Comfortable Terrain.name: Comfortable Terrain

Concussive Repair.name: Concussive Repair
Concussive Repair.description:
Frequency Once per hour

Trigger You are holding or wielding an item that would gain the broken condition from taking damage.

Sometimes, all it takes is a solid kick or whack to put something back together... for the time being. Attempt a @Check[type:crafting] check against the same DC you would use to Repair the item. Regardless of the result, the item becomes immune to your Concussive Repair for 1 day.

Critical Success The item does not gain the broken condition and remains at 1 Hit Point above its Broken Threshold. After 1 minute the item gains the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.6dNUvdb1dhToNDj3] condition. If the item gains the broken condition during this period of instability, it is destroyed.

Success As critical success, except if the item does not gain the broken condition for [[/r 1d4]] rounds.

Critical Failure The item is destroyed instead of broken.

Contortionist's Escape.description:
Requirements You are grabbed, immobilized, or restrained.

As you contort your body, you can escape from any restraints with ease. You attempt to [[/act escape skill=acrobatics]] twice using Acrobatics, and both use the same multiple attack penalty, and you only increase your multiple attack penalty once afterwards. If you get a critical failure on either of these checks, you get a failure instead.
Contortionist's Escape.name: Contortionist's Escape

Correct the Plot.name: Correct the Plot
Correct the Plot.description:
Frequency Once per day

Trigger You or an ally within 30 feet fails an attack roll or skill check.

You know the beats of this story, and can sense a dreadful plot twist coming. You take a small action that puts things back on track, giving yourself or your ally an instant of clarity within which they can change destiny. Roll a @Check[performance] check and substitute your result for the triggering roll. You must use the new roll to determine the outcome of the triggering check even if it is worse than the original.

Crafted Contrivance.name: Crafted Contrivance
Crafted Contrivance.description:
Any item you craft has a chance of becoming a crucial item that saves a life or even the day. Anytime you critically succeed in Crafting a magical item of level 15 or higher that does not have the consumable trait, the item gains one of the following activations, up to GM discretion. A creature can only gain the effect of Contract Contrivance once per day.

Activate—Take The Blow r (concentrate)

Frequency once per day

Trigger A creature holding, wearing, wielding, or otherwise having the item in their possession (such as stowed in a bag) would be reduced to 0 Hit Points or below.

Effect The triggering creature remains conscious at 1 Hit Point. Make a @Check[type:flat|dc:11]. On failure, the item is destroyed, and on success, the item is broken. If the item was already broken and it gains the broken condition from this effect, it is automatically destroyed.

Activate—Convenient Tool r (fortune, manipulate)

Frequency once per day

Trigger A creature with the item critically fails a skill check that requires or uses a tool.

Effect It turns out your item is a perfect replacement for the tool! You can reroll the triggering check and treat the result as one step better. Regardless of your result, the item becomes broken.

Crafty Trap Disassembler.name: Crafty Trap Disassembler
Crafty Trap Disassembler.description:
Part of why you are so good at putting things together is because you learned how to do so by taking items apart to begin with. You can use Crafting instead of Thievery on checks to [[/act disable-device skill=crafting]] against non-magical traps and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your checks. You use your proficiency in Crafting to determine whether you can disable certain devices that would require a specific proficiency rank in Thievery. You can use artisan's tools in place of thieves' tools for checks to Disable Device.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.Na1qfHd6AFAXoN1A]{Reverse Engineer} inventor feat, you increase the circumstance bonus from this feat to +2.

prerequisites.value: master in a Lore of a creature or creature type

Creature Indexing.name: Creature Indexing
Creature Indexing.description:
Trigger Your turn begins during an encounter with a creature whose Lore you are at least trained in.

You have knowledge about the creature at the top of your head which you can rattle off during an emergency. You can immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on the triggering creature and on a success you learn one of the following pieces of information or two pieces of information if your result is a critical success: one of its immunities, resistances, or weaknesses, or what its lowest save or highest save is. If you are legendary in this creature Lore, you learn one additional piece of information of your choice on success and critical success.

Creature Wary.name: Creature Wary

prerequisites.value: trained in a Lore of a creature or creature type

Creature Wary.description:
Trigger You would roll for initiative during an encounter with a creature whose Lore you are trained in and you are aware of the creature.

You often cast the creature as an imaginary enemy in your mind. You can use your creature Lore skill for initiative and you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your roll. Should you and the creature tie on an initiative, you always go first.

Creeping Crawler.name: Creeping Crawler
Creeping Crawler.description:
Requirements You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.j91X7x0XSomq8d60]{Prone}.

You stay low to the ground to avoid detection. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover} and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} while Crawling. When you Sneak in this way you move at the same Speed you could normally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Tj055UcNm6UEgtCg]{Crawl} or Sneak, whichever is lower and you are treated as having cover from Take Cover for the entirety of your movement. If your Sneak and Crawl speeds are the same, you increase your Speed while prone and Sneaking by 5 feet.

Cult Expert.name: Cult Expert

prerequisites.value: you have had multiple encounters with a specific cult

Cult Expert.description: You have identified a particular cult as a thorn in your side, and put together notes identifying commonalities between its members. You learn a language commonly spoken by cult members, if they have one, and can always use Religion to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on agents of the cult. You cannot roll Religion to Recall Knowledge on creatures merely aligned with the cult (for example, if a cult of Norgorberites hired a cambion mercenary), but creatures controlled by the cult (such as a giant scorpion raised by the Norgorberites, or a strange construct built by them) are subject to the effect.

Cultural Chameleon.name: Cultural Chameleon
Cultural Chameleon.description:
You are enamored with the various cultures of the world and can't help but soak up all their little details. You can choose to spend a week in a settlement studying either the culture of the settlement itself, or the culture of one ancestry that lives in the settlement in non-insignificant amounts (the GM determines whether an ancestry has enough members to count).

You can spend one week to change your selection of settlement or ancestry, and you can choose to stop receiving the benefits at any time, though if you do so, you must once again spend one week to immerse yourself in a culture, even if you would pick the exact same choices.

Settlement You can use Society to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} to know the same sorts of information that would normally require you to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.plBGdZhqq5JBl1D8]{Gather Information} using the same DC for your Recall Knowledge as the DC to Gather Information. In addition, you become an expert in the Lore skill for the settlement.

Ancestry Creatures of the chosen ancestry in the settlement initial attitude towards you is one better than it would normally be and you can use Society instead of Diplomacy to [[/act make-an-impression skill=society]] on creatures of the chosen ancestry. In addition, you become an expert in the Lore skill for the chosen ancestry.

Daring Swing.name: Daring Swing
Daring Swing.description:
Requirements You have at least one hand free and are adjacent to an object or allied creature you could swing from.

You swing through the air on an object, be it vine, chandelier, or the hand of a friend. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} and then attempt an [[/act daring-swing]]{Acrobatics check} against the Climb DC of the object you are attempting to swing from, as determined by the GM, but unconventional objects or creatures are usually at least a DC 20. If you make a 2-action Daring Swing, you can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} instead of Leap, and if you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.ZBhvJ9O8MvBFAlhq]{Quick Jump} you can use either with a single action Daring Swing. If you succeed, you swing up to 10 additional feet through the air in the same direction as your jump. If you are an expert in Acrobatics, increase the additional feet you move by 5, if you are a master increase the additional feet by 10, or increase it by 20 if you are legendary. Since you remain airborne during this movement, you avoid difficult terrain and can potentially pass over creatures or large objects if you were at least 5 feet off the ground when you started your swing.

Special If you have the panache class feature, this action gains the bravado trait.

Death Curse Survivor.name: Death Curse Survivor

prerequisites.value: You let the death curse of a linnorm fester in you for at least one fortnight

Death Curse Survivor.description:
You have faced the raw fury of a linnorm long after it ceased to live, and now you have come out remade. When a creature reduces you to 0 Hit Points, they must make a @Check[fortitude|against:class] save against your class DC. On a failure, they are inflicted with the death curse of the linnorm that cursed you.

Once per day, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5c692cCcTDXjSEzk] as a primal innate spell, but your Dragon Breath deals damage of the same type as the Breath Weapon of the linnorm that cursed you and you must select the primal tradition. If you are 20th level, the spell is heightened to 8th-rank.

Deceive Ego.name: Deceive Ego
Deceive Ego.description:
Frequency Once per day

Trigger You fail or critically fail a skill check.

You can lie so well, you fool even yourself. Make a Deception check against the same DC as the triggering check.

Critical Success You fool yourself into thinking everything is fine and treat the result of the triggering check as a success.

Success You smooth the depth of your failure and treat the result of the triggering check as one step better.

Critical Failure You are off-guard until the beginning of your next turn.

Delayed Blocker.description: You have learned to protect yourself while tactically looking for your next opening. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay}, you can choose to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raise a Shield} or cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR]{Shield} even though you would not normally be able to take an action. When you decide to take your turn, you lose a number of actions that would have been required to Raise a Shield.
Delayed Blocker.name: Delayed Blocker

prerequisites.value: Shield Block or the ability to cast shield

Desperate Repair.name: Desperate Repair
Desperate Repair.description:
You can attempt to cobble and put back items that have been destroyed. The item must not have the consumable trait. Attempts to Desperate Repair on an item destroyed by a magical effect, such as overcharging a wand, automatically fail. You cannot use this on items that are destroyed due to transformations, such as becoming a mundane object due to exhausted magic, or have parts consumed that you cannot retrieve or replace.

When you take this activity, make a @Check[type:crafting|options:action:desperate-repair] check against the Craft DC of the item at a -5 penalty. Once you have used Desperate Repair on an item, that item becomes permanently immune to your Desperate Repair regardless of the outcome of your roll. If you are legendary in Crafting, when you get a success you get a critical success instead.

Critical Success You manage to put the item back together. The item regains all of its Hit Points. Regardless of the item's condition after 1 minute, it is automatically destroyed again. If the item would be automatically destroyed from a different source, choose whichever duration is shorter.

Success As critical success, but the item is automatically destroyed after [[/r 1d4]] rounds instead of 1 minute.

Critical Failure You spend too much time putting the item together that you become distracted; you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{off-guard} for 1 round and cannot use reactions until the start of your next turn.

Devastating Finish.name: Devastating Finish
Devastating Finish.description:
Trigger You reduced a creature of a level no lower than 4 below your level to 0 Hit Points that had all of its Hit Points.

When you send someone to their grave, you become fearsome and devastating to behold. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}, and enemies your level or lower that witnessed you reducing the triggering creature to 0 Hit Points cannot reduce the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition of your Demoralize below 1 while they can see you. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.UoIjmafqNeVuiKRc]{Who's Next?} bold action.

Developed Sensory Response.name: Developed Sensory Response
Developed Sensory Response.description:
You have learned to adapt to your other senses when your main senses have been shut down due to consistent exposure in your travels. You attempt to [[/act seek skill=survival]] using your Survival instead of your Perception and your vague senses are treated as imprecise senses for the purposes of your check.

You can use Developed Sensory Response when using the Investigate or Search exploration activities, but you must move at half the normal speed you could normally move while using these exploration activities.

Difference Without a Distinction.name: Difference Without a Distinction
Difference Without a Distinction.description:
You subconsciously notice even the most minute of details as you take stock. When you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.0N8TtGSk5enoLBZ8]{Eye for Numbers}, the GM also rolls a secret @Check[society|traits:secret] check for you, and compares the result to the relevant DCs of all objects and creatures within your line of sight that are actively attempting to pass themselves off similar to the type of item you're counting–usually, the Stealth DCs for creatures, or the spell DC of the spellcaster who used illusion magic to hide an item. The GM then gives you a count of the items as per Eye for Numbers, but then also gives count of all the creatures and items whose DCs you've exceeded, also rounded to the first digit.

In addition, you can use Society to [[/act make-an-impression skill=society]] on merchants after you've used the Eye for Numbers action on their wares and if this is part of negotiating purchases for items you successfully counted, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check.

Direction Intuition.name: Direction Intuition
Direction Intuition.description:
When you are looking for where to go, your training and instincts cultivate a much clearer picture. When you use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.fJImDBQfqfjKJOhk]{Sense Direction}, you do not take an item penalty to your Sense Direction. In addition, if you spend at least 10 minutes to use Sense Direction, you gain the effects of augury for the path you would take forward if you are successful.

The outcome you receive is only in relation to the path you would take, and does not account for outside factors. For instance, if the outcome was “bad” there might be a violent storm ahead, quicksand, or a flood, but it would not tell you whether you would encounter a roaming troop of bandits known to be nearby.

Disrupting Performance.name: Disrupting Performance
Disrupting Performance.description:
Trigger A creature you can observe within 30 feet of you takes a skill action with the auditory, concentrate, or visual traits.

You make an awkward or bizarre sound, note, or gesture to foul the action the creature is attempting. Your reaction gains your choice of the auditory or visual trait. Make a @Check[performance|against:will] check against the triggering creature's Will DC. Creatures with less than a +0 Intelligence gain a +4 circumstance bonus to their Will DC. Regardless of the outcome, the creature then becomes immune to this reaction for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.BZu26T5ot8fURnpi]{Effect: Disrupting Performance}

Critical Success The creature is momentarily distracted and takes a -3 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

Success The creature takes a -2 circumstance penalty to the triggering roll.

Distracting Duelists.name: Distracting Duelists

prerequisites.value: trained in Deception or Intimidation or Bon Mot

Distracting Duelists.description:
Requirements Your partner must be trained in Diplomacy, Deception, or Intimidation.

You and your partner make obnoxious quips, riffing about the opponent constantly. While employing this teamwork, both you and your partner count as having prepared to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the other to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize}. Whenever either of you make these checks, you can use either of your positions for determining whether you can perform these actions.

Special If you or your partner has the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.0GF2j54roPFIDmXf]{Bon Mot} skill feat, you can apply these effects to your Bon Mot in addition to the listed actions.

Divine Aphorisms.name: Divine Aphorisms
Divine Aphorisms.description: Uttering phrases associated with your faith gives you extra confidence when needed. Write down two aphorisms of your deity, and when you are likely to say them (such as a follower of Calistria saying "see to your own wounds first" when advising someone to rest before seeking vengeance). The first time per day where you appropriately utter such a phrase you feel the good will of divinity. You gain the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VACvA5VRbddjt5s9] during your next encounter if it occurs within 1 hour and then become immune to this effect for one day.

Divine Intervention.name: Divine Intervention
Divine Intervention.description:
Your study and devotion of your deity has left them invested in your victories in the mortal world, and they will actively involve themselves in your success. You gain the moderate boon associated with your deity, but you must adhere to its edicts and anathema. If you ever fail to follow your deities' edicts or commit one of its anathemas, you gain the moderate curse for your deity until you atone.

Once per day, you can spend a single action with the concentrate trait and attempt a @Check[religion|dc:@self.level|adjustment:5] check against a very hard DC of your level to gain the major boon of your deity so long as you are in good standing with your deity. If you are successful, the major boon lasts for 1d4 rounds, or 1 minute if it was a critical success. If you critically fail your check, you suffer the moderate curse for your deity for 1 hour.

Don't Make Me Repeat Myself.name: Don't Make Me Repeat Myself
Don't Make Me Repeat Myself.description:
Trigger You fail or critically fail to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tHCqgwjtQtzNqVvd]{Coerce} a creature.

You back your somewhat feeble threats with a severe expression to show you really mean it, and you are not going to repeat what you just said. You attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the creature you attempted to Coerce. If you are successful, you treat the degree of success of the triggering Coerce as one better. Regardless of the result, the target becomes temporarily immune to this effect for 1 day.

Drag Away.name: Drag Away
Drag Away.description:
You excel at dragging people along as you run. When you would successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition} an enemy creature, you can instead choose to Stride up to 10 feet in a direction of your choice, or 15 feet if you got a critical success. The creature remains adjacent to you or the same distance from you had reach for your Reposition, following your path as you Stride. This is forced movement.

You can Drag Away a willing creature with a Reposition, but you must succeed at a standard DC of the creature's level and they must still be a creature you could normally Reposition.

Dream Actualization.name: Dream Actualization
Dream Actualization.description:
Frequency Once per week

You know all too well the power held within dreams, the ability to realize, imagine, and actualize your potential and envision new possibilities for yourself and others. You spend 8 hours of uninterrupted sleep creating an elaborate dreamscape for yourself which has the effects of dreaming potential. You may also assist an ally in their dreaming endeavors, if you do so, both you and the ally must remain asleep for 8 hours uninterrupted to gain the full effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.y0Vy7iNL3ET8K00C] but only your ally gains the benefits.

Embrace Terror.name: Embrace Terror
Embrace Terror.description:
Frequency Once per day

Trigger You are about to attempt a Will save against a fear effect.

Your ability to incite fear in others makes attempts to frighten you less effective. You attempt the triggering save using your modifier in Intimidation instead of your Will save. If you are legendary in Intimidation, you can use Embrace Terror once per hour instead of once per day.

Emissary of the Green.name: Emissary of the Green
Emissary of the Green.description: You have mastered the ability of communicating with animals and plants, finding yourself to be a kindred spirit and ambassador of natural life. You can now cast the innate spells you gained from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.player-options.Item.PGZeIAPlaIYGWsgH]{Language of the Wild} once per hour instead of once per day.

Endorsing Jingle.name: Endorsing Jingle
Endorsing Jingle.description:
Frequency Once per day

Requirements You are in a settlement.

You have garnered a bit of fame and can reduce the price of items you buy from a single merchant or store by promoting their business with a few songs and slogans–sung intermittently. Make a Performance check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, gaining the results below instead of the normal effects.

Critical Success The advertisement campaign was a rousing success. You gain store credits equal to four times the amount you would have earned from the Earn Income activity. The merchant or store staff's attitude towards you improves by a step.

Success As critical success, except the amount of store credits is two times the amount you would have earned from the Earn Income activity.

Critical Failure The settlement nearly runs you and your annoying song out of town. You gain a -2 circumstance penalty to all Performance checks made in the settlement for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.h68gzcPrgspuVeu0]{Effect: Endorsing Jingle}

Entrap Confession.name: Entrap Confession
Entrap Confession.description:
You know how to lay traps in your conversations or use silence to trick people into giving away information they usually wouldn't have. You can spend 10 minutes in conversation with a target to subtly goad them into answering a single yes or no question about themselves. Make a [[/act entrap-confession]]{Diplomacy} check against the target creature's Will DC. The GM may modify the DC based on how difficult the answer would be to ascertain in conversation, but the DC is usually at least a standard DC of the target's level.

Critical Success You receive a definitive yes or no answer and the target is unaware that you have learned the answer.

Success As critical success, but the target is aware they have given you the answer.

Failure You are too subtle, and fail to goad the target.

Critical Failure The target becomes aware you are attempting to get an answer to your specific question and can choose to leave your question unanswered or give a false answer.

Entrap in Faux Pas.name: Entrap in Faux Pas
Entrap in Faux Pas.description:
Trigger You would get a failure on an attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} or to make a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.DCb62iCBrJXy0Ik6]{Request} with witnesses present.

You lead a creature into using bad manners, but then forgive them in an attempt to persuade them further. Attempt a @Check[society] check against the same DC as the triggering check. Regardless of the result, the target is then immune for 10 minutes.

Success The target feels embarrassed in front of their peers. You reduce the DC of the triggering check by the number of creatures that witnessed the creature's bad manners, up to a maximum of 5.

Critical Failure You embarrass yourself instead of the target, reducing your check by the number of creatures that witnessed your bad manners, up to a maximum of 5.

Environmental Ascent.name: Environmental Ascent
Environmental Ascent.description:
Requirements You are in natural terrain.

By calling upon the roots and vines of the primal landscape around you with primal magic, you can overcome obstacles more easily. You can use Nature to [[/act climb skill=nature]] instead of Athletics by calling on the nearby flora and earth to help you ascend. If you're trained in Athletics and you attempt an Athletics check to Climb, you instead gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Climb. If you are a master in Nature, you can call upon earth and flora even in locations they are scarce by increasing the DC of your Climb check by 5. When you Climb in this way, your Climb gains the primal and manipulate traits.

Special If you have a climb Speed, you instead gain a +5-foot status bonus to your climb Speed when you are in natural terrain, or a +10-foot status bonus if you are legendary in Nature.

Erudite Mentor.name: Erudite Mentor
Erudite Mentor.description: You are a patient and well spoken mentor when instructing others on magical matters, perhaps having learned from professors in your own life or having experience being one yourself. You can use Arcana to Aid allies on Arcana, Nature, Occultism or Religion check to Recall Knowledge, Learn a Spell or perform an action with the magical trait and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your check to Aid.

Escape Artist.name: Escape Artist
Escape Artist.description: Being caught sometimes comes with the job, so you put in extra training into getting out of even the stickiest situations. You can use Thievery to [[/act escape skill=thievery]] instead of your unarmed Strike modifier, but if the effect you are attempting to Escape is from a creature or active spell effect, you take a -2 circumstance penalty to the roll. If you are a master in Thievery, you no longer take a penalty to Escape using Thievery.

Essence Magic.name: Essence Magic

prerequisites.value: ability to cast spells from spell slots

Essence Magic.description:
By specializing and harnessing the power of a particular essence of magic, you gain access to additional magic of that type. Choose one of the four essences listed below that matches the tradition of your spellcasting class. You gain a spell of 2nd-rank or lower with one of the listed traits from a tradition other than your own. You cast the spell as a spell of your spellcasting tradition. If you are at least 15th level, the spell you chose is heightened to 3rd-rank, and if you are at least 19th level it is heightened to 4th-rank.

If you are a prepared caster, you learn the spell and once per hour you can spend 10 minutes to replace an already prepared spell slot with this spell.

If you are a spontaneous caster, you add the spell to your spell repertoire and you treat it as a signature spell.

Mind (Arcane, Occult) Your selection must have one of the following traits: mental, prediction, illusion or scrying.

Matter (Arcane, Primal) Your selection must have one of the following traits: air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood.

Life (Divine, Primal) Your selection must have one of the following traits: healing, vitality or void.

Spirit (Divine, Occult) Your selection must have one of the following traits: mental, spirit, or void.

Special You can select this feat twice, selecting the other essence associated with your tradition if you take this feat again.

Establish Etiquette.name: Establish Etiquette
Establish Etiquette.description:
Even in the midst of battle, there are rules to follow and norms to keep. When you use Establish Etiquette, choose another creature within 30 feet of you and attempt a @Check[society|against:will] check against their Will DC. If you are successful, you appeal to the creature's pride, honor, or other characteristics to follow an established etiquette for 1 minute and they are immune to your Establish Etiquette for 1 hour.

Each turn the creature does not follow the established etiquette, it takes a -1 circumstance penalty to its attack rolls, or a -2 circumstance penalty if you critically succeeded at your Society check. If it follows the established etiquette, it gains a +1 circumstance bonus on its attack rolls until its next turn or it breaks etiquette (immediately gaining the penalties again if it does). The creature can choose to prematurely end your Establish Etiquette by spending a single action with the auditory or concentrate trait to deny your appeal to etiquette.

You and your allies must choose to follow the established etiquette when you take actions against the creature, and if you do not follow the established etiquette against the creature the effect immediately ends and all creatures who witnessed you or your allies do so are temporarily immune to your Establish Etiquette for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.1LTTY9ZdDmC6WFGf]{Effect: Establish Etiquette}

10 Paces You choose to only make Strikes with ranged weapons, and only within their first range increment.

Dishonorable Striking You choose to ignore circumstance penalties to AC.

Hands Alone You choose to only make Strikes with non-stance unarmed attacks.

No Words You choose not to use auditory or linguistic actions.

One Handed You choose to keep a hand free.

Right of Way You choose to take exactly one action with the move trait each turn.

Solo Fight You choose not to attack creatures that were attacked by another creature this round.

Exceptional Researcher.name: Exceptional Researcher
Exceptional Researcher.description: Spending hours in old libraries poring through mystic texts makes you especially adept in such environments. When attempting a roll as part of the research subsystem when researching magical topics or magical societies and cultures (usually these use arcana, religion, nature, occultism and sometimes society), you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the roll, and if you get a success or critical success, you obtain 1 additional RP.

Exclusive Activation.name: Exclusive Activation
Exclusive Activation.description: You prevent your creations from falling into the wrong hands with safeguard measures that allow only a selected few to use them... or else. When you successfully Craft an item that requires an activation, you can specify a requirement that allows it to be Activated normally, such as a password or hidden button. Any creature that does not know the requirement that attempts to Activate the item automatically fails unless they attempt a @Check[type:crafting|dc:resolve(max(0, @actor.system.skills.crafting.rank - 3) * 2 + @actor.system.skills.crafting.dc)] or @Check[type:thievery|dc:resolve(max(0, @actor.system.skills.crafting.rank - 3) * 2 + @actor.system.skills.crafting.dc)] check against your Crafting DC in order to Activate the item. On critical failure, the item self-destructs and is destroyed dealing 1d4 piercing damage per two item levels to the creature that attempted to Activate the item as well as creatures in a 5-foot emanation. When you become legendary in Crafting, the DC increases by 2, and the damage die on a critical failure increases to a d6s instead of d4s.

Fearsome Pelts.name: Fearsome Pelts
Fearsome Pelts.description:
You have learned to use the remains of monsters as part of your scare tactics. You can spend 1 day to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} the body of a monster into a wearable pelt, trinket, or other symbolic item and you can Craft the item using Survival. The Craft DC for the item uses an item level equal to the monster you are using to Craft and the item must be a wearable item of at least 1 Bulk.

When you wear the remains of a monster, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} creatures of the same type as your pelt and you do not take a penalty to your Demoralize for not sharing a language. You only gain the circumstance bonus if the pelt came from a creature of equal or higher level than the creature you are attempting to Demoralize. If the creature is not of the same type, but shares a trait with the creature your pelt was made from, you gain these effects as well, but the circumstance bonus is +1 instead of +2.

Fence's Senses.name: Fence's Senses
Fence's Senses.description: You live or die by your ability to differentiate treasures and worthless scrap when it comes to stolen goods. You can use Thievery to identify an item's value, and may use Thievery instead of the normal skill to [[/act identify-magic skill=thievery]] on magic items with the illusion or poison traits. You must be aware the item has these traits in order to use Identify Magic on the item.

Fey Charm.name: Fey Charm
Fey Charm.description: Well known for being as elusive and tricky as they are charming, you have learned how to tap into the charisma of the fey when interacting with creatures of the primal world. When making Deception or Diplomacy checks to [[/act lie skill=nature]] or [[/act make-an-impression skill=nature]] to creatures with the animal, beast, plant, fungi or fey traits, you can use Nature instead of the appropriate skill. You must still be able to communicate with these creatures in order to make these checks against them, such as having the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.ahyQpMVDIqhvXkQ4]{Plant Empathy} class feat to speak with a plant.

Find Binding Pins.name: Find Binding Pins
Find Binding Pins.description:
Before committing to picking a lock, you feel out how various parts react when you apply pressure. Attempt a @Check[thievery] check against the DC of a lock within your reach. Regardless of the result, you cannot use Find Binding Pins on the same lock for 1 day.

Critical Success The next time you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2EE4aF4SZpYf0R6H]{Pick that Lock}, you treat the result of your check as one step better and you gain an additional success, or two additional successes if your check is a critical success.

Success The next time you Pick that Lock against the target lock, you treat the result of your check as one step better.

Critical Failure You greatly misjudge the construction of the lock. The next time you Pick a Lock against the target lock, you treat the result of your check as one step worse.

Fine Art Studies.name: Fine Art Studies
Fine Art Studies.description: You have done a lot of reading and researching in the name of pursuing your artistic craft. You can always use Performance to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on any knowledge related to the fine arts or the history of fine arts. If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.lFwfUvH2708rl6i3]{Virtuosic Performer}, you can add the bonus from the feat if the specific piece of knowledge you are trying to recall is related to your specialty. You can also use Performance to obtain research points instead of the normal check at a -2 circumstance penalty to the check.

Firewalk.name: Firewalk
Firewalk.description:
Your movements are so quick and light-footed that you do not harm yourself when you step through danger. You Stride up to your Speed. During this movement, you can try to move through the space of hazardous terrain. Attempt an @Check[type:acrobatics] check against the DC of the effect that caused the hazardous terrain or a @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:20]{ }, whichever is higher, as soon as you try to pass through its space. You can Firewalk using Climb, Fly, Swim, or another action instead of Stride in the appropriate environment.

Success You move through the hazardous terrain's space without taking damage, treating each of its squares as difficult terrain (every 5 feet costs 10 feet of movement).

Failure You take damage as normal.

Flip Into Hand.name: Flip Into Hand
Flip Into Hand.description:
Requirements You have at least one hand free and are standing next to an adjacent unattended item of L Bulk.

You have learned how to kick items on the ground into a ready hand. Attempt an @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:20] check. You can perform this action during a Stride if during your movement you become adjacent to an unattended item of L Bulk or less. If you are legendary in Acrobatics, you can flip two items into your hands as part of the same action provided you have the hands free to carry them.

Success You flip the required item into your hands and are holding the item.

Failure You fail to flip the item into your hands.

Critical Failure You accidentally flip the item away from you, landing 5 feet away from you.

Follow Crime Spree.name: Follow Crime Spree
Follow Crime Spree.description:
Requirements You are in a settlement.

You use your criminal knowhow to recognize patterns in crimes. You can use Thievery to [[/act track skill=thievery]] creatures if you start at the scene of a crime. If the crime was committed within 1 day, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your attempts to Track.

Friends in High Places.name: Friends in High Places
Friends in High Places.description:
Trigger You or an ally fail or critically fail a Diplomacy or Intimidation check against a creature who serves nobility or an organization.

You use your established understanding of the settlement and its social circles to name-drop important figures should things not go your way. Attempt a @Check[society] check against a standard DC of the targeted creature's level.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.mYaaE8LUCVofTODA]{Effect: Friends in High Places}

Critical Success You or the triggering ally can reroll the triggering check with a +2 circumstance bonus.

Success As critical success, except the circumstance bonus is +1.

Front-Line Adept.name: Front-Line Adept
Front-Line Adept.description: You have learned to become more adapted to standard combat tactics. You gain your choice of the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.qQt3CMrhLkUV1wCv]{Sudden Charge} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.2xk4jdwcCfmasYfT]{Vicious Swing} activity.

Fungal Ward.name: Fungal Ward
Fungal Ward.description:
Frequency Once per hour

Requirements You are in an area of nature or an area containing slain enemies.

By observing the unique properties of fungus to grow amidst decay and unusual conditions, you ward yourself against life-draining energies. By spending 10 minutes gathering the source of decay or nature, you can place a fungal growth on a creature of your choice, granting them void resistance equal to half your level to the first source of void damage they take until your next daily preparations.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.knhj2UJsKqLgoNwD]{Effect: Fungal Ward}

Gambler's Bluff.name: Gambler's Bluff

prerequisites.value: master in Games Lore or Gambling Lore

Gambler's Bluff.description: After many long hours spent playing games of deduction and chance, you have developed an ironclad poker face, making it impossible for others to discern your true motives. When you Lie you can choose to use Games Lore or Gambling Lore instead of Deception and when a creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} on you to determine if you were lying, you can choose to use your Games Lore or Gambling Lore DC instead of your Deception DC.

Global Presence.name: Global Presence
Global Presence.description:
Your fame precedes you even in the highest echelons of the farthest societies. Once per month, you can spend a week of downtime to influence a major political or economic decision in the region you're in. Attempt a @Check[society] check against a hard DC of the settlement's level. If you're trying to influence an area bigger than a settlement, for example a county or a duchy, use the target area's capital settlement's level instead. If you're trying to influence a country, an empire, or similar, the DC is a very hard DC of the highest level settlement in the area's level.

When you influence political or economic decisions in this way, you can choose to prevent or cause an event to happen, such as removing or stationing a political figure in office, or you can choose to delay or expedite events that are likely to take place by 1 month. The GM might choose to increase or decree the DC or apply circumstance penalties to your checks for significant changes to outcomes, such as the removal of a monarch from a position of power, or have other outcomes result from your choices.

Give Offerings.name: Give Offerings
Give Offerings.description:
You make a point of leaving out offerings to that which you worship. When you make your daily preparations, you can leave out offerings to the gods to keep you safe. These offerings might include food, wine, or other trinkets of at least 1 sp in value. If you do, you gain a +1 status bonus to your first non-trivial Religion check of the day.

Alternatively, instead of offerings you can spend the money on something the deity you worship would support to gain this bonus, but you must spend an amount equal to 1% of the lump sum gold value for a character of your level and you cannot directly benefit from the expenditure in any way.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.d5SYY8oGAXb5dYIQ]{Effect: Give Offerings}

God-Warrior.name: God-Warrior
God-Warrior.description: You have siphoned off some of the deity's power as your own, having claimed a portion of their sacred domain and broken it from them. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.ckUOoqOM7Kg7VqxB]{Avatar} as a divine innate spell once per day. You take the form of the deity you battled, though not their appearance, modifying it to reveal a new, legendary appearance for yourself.

Gossip Collector.description: You influence people by using what secrets you've learned about them through gossip or rumors. The gossip does not necessarily have to be true, but perpetuated by others and damaging. When you Gather Information on a specific creature within a settlement, you learn one small secret about the target. You can choose to reveal this secret as part of a Charisma-based skill check against that creature, gaining a +2 circumstance bonus to your check if your Gather Information was successful, or a -2 penalty if your Gather Information was a critical failure. If you Gather Information on a specific creature and learn a secret about it, they are immune to Gossip Collector for 1 month.
Gossip Collector.name: Gossip Collector

Graceful Companions.name: Graceful Companions
Graceful Companions.description: When flattering people, you put a few good words in for your allies as well. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression}, you can choose up to 5 creatures to receive the results of your Make an Impression as well, even if they aren't presently with you. Your allies do not gain the effects of your Make an Impression unless they identify themselves by mentioning you and may choose to avoid doing so if you worsened their attitude. When you become a master in Society, you can choose up to 10 creatures, and if you become legendary in Society, you can choose up to 20 creatures.

Green Thumb.name: Green Thumb
Green Thumb.description: Cultivating plants comes naturally to you, whether magical or otherwise. You can Craft items with the fungus, plant, or wood traits or alchemical plants using Nature instead of Crafting. If you use Nature to Craft, you use your proficiency in Nature instead of Crafting to determine what level items you can Craft. If you Craft alchemical plants, they lose the alchemical trait and gain the primal trait.

Group Cover.name: Group Cover
Group Cover.description: You have learned to cover the tracks of large groups with ease, allowing your allies to go undetected along with you. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{Cover Tracks} and your allies @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert}, you attempt a single Survival check to cover the tracks of all of you instead of each of you rolling individually.

Haggle.name: Haggle
Haggle.description:
The art of haggling is one only the best merchants know. If you spend 1 minute in conversation with someone selling goods, you may attempt to Haggle, choosing one item you wish to buy and attempting a @Check[Mercantile Lore|against:will] check against the Will DC of the person you are conversing with. You cannot choose a formula when you Haggle. Regardless of your result, the target is temporarily immune to your attempts to Haggle it for 1 day.

Critical Success You manage to reduce the price of the item by an amount equal to the cost of the item's formula.

Success As critical success, except the amount is half the item's formula cost.

Critical Failure Your attempts to haggle insult the merchant! They refuse to sell you the requested item and their attitude towards you becomes one step worse or unfriendly, whichever is worse. The creature continues to refuse to sell you the item until their attitude towards you changes to be indifferent or better.

Hardened Combatant.name: Hardened Combatant
Hardened Combatant.description: You have seen enough battles to not be swayed easily. You gain resistance to critical hits equal to half your level and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against critical effects or effects that would occur on a critical hit.

Harmless Bystander.name: Harmless Bystander
Harmless Bystander.description:
Trigger You roll initiative.

Requirements You have not been observed taking a hostile action against any of the creatures in the current encounter.

You pretend you have nothing to do with the conflict that is about to take place. You roll Initiative using your Deception. Any non-ally creature must attempt to [[/act sense-motive]] against you to realize you are hostile to them and they cannot make reactions against you until you take a hostile action against the creature or its allies. If you are wielding a weapon or cannot reasonably hide yourself as a bystander (for example, being out in the wilderness where there is no crowd), the creature gets a +4 circumstance bonus to their Sense Motive and if you are observed taking a hostile action you are automatically recognized as hostile. Regardless of the results of the creature's Sense Motive, once you are observed being hostile, non-allied creatures are temporarily immune to your use of Harmless Bystander for 1 day.

Haughty Correction.name: Haughty Correction
Haughty Correction.description:
Trigger A creature within 30 feet you can see just Cast a Spell, attempted a counteract check, or attempted to Recall Knowledge.

Watching an opponent's magical attempts leads to you point out the flaws in their process, nitpicking the placement of their runes or the intonation of their words when casting in order to show off your magical knowledge. Attempt an [[/act haughty-correction]]{Arcana} check and compare the result to the Will DC of the triggering creature. If the creature critically succeeded in the triggering action, you get one degree worse on your results. If the creature critically failed the triggering action, you get one degree of success better on your results. Regardless of the result, the target is then temporarily immune for 1 minute.

Critical Success The target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} for 1 minute as they are distracted by your frustrating interruptions. The target can end the effect early with a rebuttal to your Haughty Correction by spending a single action with the concentrate trait or by making a Recall Knowledge check to counter your correction. The creature does not gain the stupefied condition until after the triggering action is completed.

Success As critical success, but the target is stupefied 1 until the end of their next turn.

Failure The target is unaffected.

Critical Failure You fumble your response and take a -2 circumstance penalty to Intelligence-based skill checks and Perception checks and DCs for 1 minute or until you spend a single action with the concentrate trait to regain your composure. @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.fKfRgiis6hG1xIXV]{Effect: Haughty Correction Critical Failure}

Haunt Legend.name: Haunt Legend
Haunt Legend.description: Your knowledge and skill when it comes to haunts is nigh-unparalleled and few can match your mastery over the field.
