You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to skill checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Search}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge}, and to Disable haunts and you can use Occultism or Religion checks against haunts even if they would not normally allow those checks, using its Occultism or Religion DC for its DC or the highest DC required to Disable it if it does not have an Occultism or Religion DC.

Hazard Heuristics.name: Hazard Heuristics
Hazard Heuristics.description: Your familiarity with magical objects and environments grants you an improved sense for magical hazards and how to safely disenchant them. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Perception checks to find magical hazards and to Disable Device on hazards with the magical trait. If you are a master in Arcana, this bonus increases to +2.

Helter Shelter.name: Helter Shelter
Helter Shelter.description: You can produce a suitable shelter in unlikely places with little to no preparation. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist}, you also produce the effects of a cozy cabin except the effect does not automatically end when you leave the cabin, the cabin is 40 feet on each side, can inhabit up to 10 creatures instead of the normal amount, and it can withstand any weather conditions without being destroyed. If you use Subsist again while you have this effect active, you can choose to replace the previous effect with a new one, or extend the duration of your cabins if you are nearby.

Herald Stained.name: Herald Stained
Herald Stained.description: Sacred blood empowers you, granting you divine power. You gain the nephilim trait if you did not already have it. Only the parts of you which touched blood change visually. You gain a 1st and 5th level nephilim ancestry feat of your choice.

prerequisites.value: You have touched the blood of a creature with the herald trait as it lay dying

Here, There, Everywhere.name: Here, There, Everywhere
Here, There, Everywhere.description:
Requirements Your partner is at least trained in Deception.

When one of you heckles the opponent, the other jumps in to stab them in the back. While you are employing this teamwork, as long as an opponent is within both your and your partner's reach, it is considered @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg]{Off-Guard} to both of your melee attacks due to flanking. In addition, when one of you uses @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QNAVeNKtHA0EUw4X]{Feint} against an opponent, they may choose the following results instead of the usual ones.

Critical Success The target is off-guard against your partner's melee attacks until the end of your partner's next turn.

Success The target is off-guard against your partner's first melee attack before the end of your partner's next turn.

Critical Failure Your feint backfires. You are off-guard against melee attacks the target attempts against you until the end of your next turn.

Honed-Shot Precision.name: Honed-Shot Precision
Honed-Shot Precision.description:
Trigger You critically succeeded at a ranged Strike against an enemy and the enemy is still above 0 Hit Points after this Strike.

You strike true, leaving you the opportunity you need to finish the job. Your ranged Strikes deal 1 additional precision damage per weapon damage die against the required enemy. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.Ig9HaamKNFhmhIYk]{Pinpoint Assault} bold reaction.

prerequisites.value: trained in at least one martial ranged weapon

How Does It Tick?.name: How Does It Tick?
How Does It Tick?.description: At the end of the day, solving problems is what engineering is all about. You can use Engineering Lore to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on constructs and on hazards or objects with the clockwork trait with a +2 circumstance bonus to your check. When you fail (but don't critically fail) a Recall Knowledge check using Engineering Lore, you learn a bit of true knowledge and a bit of erroneous knowledge, but you don't have any way to differentiate which is which.

Hunger Pangs.name: Hunger Pangs

prerequisites.value: You survived the Forbidden Cravings curse

Hunger Pangs.description:
Trigger You would take void damage.

You have felt the starving curse of a ghoul and survived. However, the hunger you felt, both as an insatiable ambition and literal ravenousness still lingers within you—much as it lay dormant within you before the curse manifested. You gain void healing for 1 minute, and if the triggering effect would also restore Hit Points to undead, such as harm, you regain Hit Points as normal for the effect.

In return, you become ravenously hungry for flesh for as long as you have this void healing. While in this state, when you see a living creature reduced to 0 Hit Points, you must make a Will save against a standard DC of your level or you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AdPVz7rbaVSRxHFg]{Fascinated} by them as you are overwhelmed by the desire to consume their flesh, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned 1} if you critically failed your save The fascinated condition does not end normally and lasts until you can no longer perceive the creature reduced to 0 Hit Points, the creature regains Hit Points, or you spend 3-actions to calm your desires to consume flesh (these actions need not be consecutive).

Hypersenses.name: Hypersenses
Hypersenses.description:
You have become so firm with your ability to sense that you gain the ability to perceive through a heightened sense. During your daily preparations, choose one of the following senses to gain access to until your next daily preparations.

  • Hearing as a precise sense with a range of 20 feet.
  • Scent as an imprecise sense with a range of 30 feet or as a precise sense out to 20 feet if you already had scent as an imprecise sense.
  • Tremorsense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet.

  • Wavesense as an imprecise sense out to 30 feet.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.Xu3thEXzrCtxjcZw]{Effect: Hypersenses}

Identify Divine Presence.name: Identify Divine Presence
Identify Divine Presence.description: When you close your eyes and calm your mind, you can sense when something not of this world is nearby. Make a Religion check. You compare your result against the @Check[religion|against:deceoption]{Deception DC} or @Check[religion|against:stealth]{Stealth DC}, whichever is higher, of creatures or magic with the celestial, fiend, monitor, or undead traits within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30]. If the creature or item does not have a Deception or Stealth DC, you use a standard DC of the creature or item's level. You learn which trait the creature or item possesses and that it is present, but you do not know their source or whereabouts. If there are no creatures or items present with the listed traits, but there was a creature or item within the area in the last 24 hours, you detect that there was a presence here but it has moved on. You can use this skill feat as you would detect magic during Exploration Mode. If you are legendary in Religion, you can also learn the creature's home plane (such as the Void or the Outer Rifts).

If Trees Could Talk.name: If Trees Could Talk
If Trees Could Talk.description: Through a rudimentary knowledge of primal magic or a connection to nature, you can derive information from the natural world around you. You can cast 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BX5UIAUarWG43Fg2] at will as a primal innate spell. If you're a master in Nature, if you successfully Seek a creature's location as part of Casting the Spell you can also @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.sn2hIy1iIJX9Vpgj]{Point Out} the creature as a free action.

Illusory Infiltrator.name: Illusory Infiltrator
Illusory Infiltrator.description:
Frequency once per hour

By using minor illusory tricks and subtle incantations, you are able to assist yourself in stealthy pursuits by camouflaging yourself using a veil of magic. For 1 minute, you can use your Arcana or Occultism modifier instead of your Stealth modifier to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}. If you Hide or Sneak in this way, they gain the concentrate and illusion traits. For every round you Hide or Sneak, you take a –1 circumstance penalty as the magic wanes over time.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.nS6qmTng0LuNb7ew]{Effect: Illusory Infiltrator}

[[/act hide skill=arcana traits=concentrate,illusion]]

[[/act hide skill=occultism traits=concentrate,illusion]]

[[/act sneak skill=arcana traits=concentrate,illusion]]

[[/act sneak skill=occultism traits=concentrate,illusion]]

Imaginary Trick.name: Imaginary Trick
Imaginary Trick.description: As a purveyor of the obscure and esoteric, you have gleaned a basic talent for illusions. You can cast 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.0zU8CPejjQFnhZFI]{figment} at will as an occult innate spell. If you're a master in Occultism, the spell is heightened to 3rd rank. If you're legendary in Occultism, the spell is heightened to 4th rank.

Imitation Infiltration.name: Imitation Infiltration
Imitation Infiltration.description:
If you're sure a place can be entered, you're sure it can be entered by you specifically. If you observe a creature disappear or pass through an obstacle, you can spend 1 minute retracing the creature's steps and making a @Check[stealth] check against a standard DC of the creature's level. If you succeed, you learn how the creature passed through the obstacle or disappeared and can attempt to do so yourself. If the creature had a means of travel that you are not able to reproduce, such as flight or teleportation, you increase the DC of the check to a very hard DC of the creature's level and can accomplish the infiltration through sheer will and improvisation.

For example, if a creature flies across a bottomless pit, walks through a solid wall, swims in lava, or uses teleportation, you can use your own knowledge of infiltration to recreate a similar act even though you would not normally be able to do so. This does not allow you to perform tasks that would otherwise be impossible for any creature other than the creature you observed (subject to GM discretion).

Impossible Flow.name: Impossible Flow
Impossible Flow.description:
Nothing ever slows your momentum as you move. When you Tumble Through, the presence of an enemy doesn't make the squares difficult terrain. In addition, when you use Acrobatics to Escape, you can attempt your Acrobatics check twice and take the better result. This is a fortune effect.

Foundry Note The rule element to apply the "roll-twice-take-higher" effect exists, but does not activate. Please do this part manually until that is fixed.

Infectious Socialite.description: You're always at your best when in social situations. You gain the ability to cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.VACvA5VRbddjt5s9] as an arcane innate cantrip. In addition, you can choose to add the subtle trait to your infectious enthusiasm in a social encounter, allowing you to bypass any social faux pas that would result from Casting the Spell, but allies do not gain any effects when cast in this way.
Infectious Socialite.name: Infectious Socialite

Influence Nature+.name: Influence Nature+
Influence Nature+.description:
With patience and time, you can make bird calls, leave game trails, and ultimately influence the behavior of a certain type of animals in the region to favor and even aid you in the days to come.

The GM determines the DC of any check required and the amount of time your work requires (usually at least a day or two of downtime). While you can't directly control how you've influenced nature, you can hope for certain effects, such as easier hunts or birds falling silent whenever danger is approaching.

If you're legendary in Nature, you can elicit these same adjustments to animal behavior in the area by spending only 10 minutes.

While you are near the location where you influenced nature successfully, you are considered to have taken the action to prepare to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} for an action that creatures or the environment would be able to Aid you in (subject to GM discretion). You use Nature for your check to Aid when you call upon nature in this way. After you call upon Aid in this way, you cannot do so again for 10 minutes.

prerequisites.value: Shield Block or the ability to cast shield

Interlocked Shields.name: Interlocked Shields
Interlocked Shields.description:
Requirements You are adjacent to your partner.

You interlock your defenses to make yourselves both impenetrable. While employing this teamwork, when one of you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.xjGwis0uaC2305pm]{Raises a Shield} or casts the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.TVKNbcgTee19PXZR] spell, the other gains a +1 circumstance bonus to their AC as long as the shield is raised or the shield spell is active. If both of you have shields raised or the shield spell active, increase the circumstance bonus by 1 while you are benefiting from their circumstance bonuses. In addition, when you or your partner makes a Step, you can use a free action to Step to remain adjacent to your partner.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.09jzA3U88ZStsE7K]{Effect: Interlocked Shields}

Invigorative Breath.name: Invigorative Breath
Invigorative Breath.description:
Frequency once per day

You take a deep breath and feel some of your energy return. You instantly recover 1 Focus Point.

Item Arcanum.name: Item Arcanum
Item Arcanum.description:
As a learned student of the arcane, you understand how to unravel the secrets of magic items of all kinds. When attempting a Nature, Religion or Occultism check to Trick Magic Item, you can instead choose to roll Arcana instead at a -4 circumstance penalty even if the item normally couldn't be Tricked with Arcana.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.hrq3NOpS6148aVY1]{Unified Theory} skill feat, you no longer take a circumstance penalty to Trick Magic Items from other traditions.

Know the Quarry.description:
Trigger You roll initiative in an encounter with at least one animal or beast.

You are well accustomed to the habits of the wild, and adjust yourself accordingly. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on the triggering animal or beast.
Know the Quarry.name: Know the Quarry

Language of the Wild.name: Language of the Wild
Language of the Wild.description:
You have learned how to communicate with plants or wildlife, perhaps through spending time among them or through being taught how by a druid.

You gain either @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.BBvV7qoXGdw09q1C] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.qvwIwJ9QBihy8R0t] as 3rd-rank primal innate spells. You can cast the innate spell you picked once per day.

Special You can select this feat twice, gaining the ability to cast the spell you didn't select the first time once per day as a 3rd-rank primal innate spell.

Last Cry.name: Last Cry
Last Cry.description:
Frequency Once per day

Trigger You would be reduced to 0 Hit Points by a creature but not immediately killed.

Even when you fall unconscious, your foes remain weary of you. You immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} the triggering creature. If your check is successful, you remain at 1 Hit Point and remain standing instead of falling unconscious, and your wounded condition increases by 1.

Leather Skin.name: Leather Skin
Leather Skin.description: You've roughed it so long and weathered your body against so many harsh conditions, you hardly feel nagging pains more. When you use Survival to [[/act administer-first-aid skill=survival]] on yourself, you can remove any persistent damage instead of only bleed damage. You must still attempt a Survival check against the DC as normal (usually the DC of the effect that caused the persistent damage). In addition, when you would take persistent damage from an effect, you attempt the flat check to recover from persistent damage before you take damage instead of after.

Lie Deterrence.name: Lie Deterrence
Lie Deterrence.description: People think twice before making false statements before you. When someone tries to Lie to you during a conversation, use your Intimidation DC if it is higher than your Perception DC to determine whether they succeed.

Life Fish in Water.name: Life Fish in Water
Life Fish in Water.description:
Requirements You are in the location associated with your related Lore.

Your knowledge of your surroundings gives you an advantage living in it. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to saves against severe cold, heat, or weather, and to saves and checks against hazards normal for the required location. You can use the required Lore to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} instead of the normal skill. When you become a master in the required Lore, you treat your degree of success on checks to Subsist as one step better.

prerequisites.value: trained in a Lore related to a settlement or region

Magic Item Legend.description: Your ability to draw out the true power of magic items is unparalleled. During daily preparations you can select up to 2 non-consumable magic items with an Activation that has a set DC. The DC of the effects of these magic items becomes equal to your class DC or spell DC -2 instead of the normal DC, whichever is higher.
Magic Item Legend.name: Magic Item Legend

Magical Feedback.name: Magical Feedback

prerequisites.value: Counterspell, or the ability to cast dispel magic

Magical Feedback.description:
Trigger You successfully counteract a spell using either dispel magic or Counterspell for the second time during an encounter.

You repurpose some of the magical energy from the spells you dissipated to power up your own. You regain the most recent spell slot you spent to dispel magic or to Counterspell. If you Cast a Spell with this spell slot, your spell gains the bold trait. You lose this spell slot after you stop celebrating your triumph. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.BZizB3VFYoo6bGcs]{Evoke Surge} bold activity.

Martial Assistance.description: You have learned how to grant help to those that need it through your own training. When you Aid an ally's attack roll with a weapon and you roll a success, you get a critical success instead and if you get a natural 1 on your check to Aid, you do not treat your degree of success as one worse.
Martial Assistance.name: Martial Assistance

Mask Scent.name: Mask Scent
Mask Scent.description:
When you have access to powerful scents in the area, you know just how to mask the scent. You can spend 10 minutes applying various combinations of nearby scents to mask up to 5 creatures' scents for 1 hour. The GM makes a secret @Check[survival] check to determine your effectiveness. If your result exceeds the Perception DC of a creature with scent, creatures treat their scent as one step less precise when attempting to detect a creature with a masked scent, or two steps less if it was a critical success. Creatures with a vague sense generally do not automatically detect creatures, but may still detect the odor of what you used to mask a scent. If a creature with scent observes a creature that used Mask Scent, they regain their senses with respect to that creature by acclimating their nose to the new scent.

In addition, when you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SB7cMECVtE06kByk]{Cover Tracks}, you are automatically considered to be masking your scent and creatures with scent take a -2 circumstance penalty to their Survival when attempting to Track you while using scent.

Mastered Skill.description: You develop into a master of one of your skills. You become a master in a skill of your choice that you are an expert in.
Mastered Skill.name: Mastered Skill

Mature Pet.name: Mature Pet
Mature Pet.description:
Your pet has become more advanced than other creatures like it. Choose one of the following familiar abilities for your pet to gain as abilities: @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.92lgSEPFIDLvKOCF], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.7ZxPS0UU7pf7wjp0], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.mK3mAUWiRLZZYNdz], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.2fiQzoEKu6YUnrU9], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.qTxH8mSOvc4PMzrP], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.cT5octWchU4gjrhP], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.v7zE3tKQb9G6PaYU], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.jevzf9JbJJibpqaI], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.fmsVItn94FeY5Q3X], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.familiar-abilities.Item.zyMRLQnFCQVpltiR]. If you gain a new pet, you can choose 1 ability for your new pet to gain when you first gain your pet. If you select speech and your pet would normally be incapable of speaking a language, you and the creature can instead communicate in a way that only the two of you understand.

Special If you gain a familiar and would retrain the Pet general feat, you can retrain this feat as part of retraining Pet.

Meat Shield.name: Meat Shield
Meat Shield.description: You are able to use the bodies of others to defend yourself from harm. You gain standard cover as long as you have a creature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, using the grabbed creatures space for the purposes of determining cover. You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} with the creature while you have them grabbed if your cover would apply to the effect that dealt the triggering damage. When you Shield Block with the creature, its Hardness is half its level and it takes damage equal to your level or the same damage you would take from the effect that triggered your Shield Block, whichever is less. After you use a grabbed creature to Shield Block, they can immediately attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.SkZAQRkLLkmBQNB9]{Escape} and they cannot be used to Shield Block again for 10 minutes.

Medicinal Countercurser.name: Medicinal Countercurser
Medicinal Countercurser.description: You know enough about the symptoms of various curses to be able to differentiate them and know what might be ahead. You can Recall Knowledge on afflictions with the curse trait using Medicine. In addition, once per day you can attempt to counteract one curse afflicting the target by spending 10 minutes employing various medicinal remedies and you use your modifier in Medicine for your counteract. If the curse comes from a cursed item or other external source, a success indicates that the target creature can rid itself of the cursed item, but it doesn't remove the curse from the item.

Menacing Approach.description: Your posture and movement provoke fear in your enemy. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} a creature and then immediately Stride towards them. If your Demoralize was successful, your movement does not provoke reactions from the creature you successfully Demoralized. If you are legendary in Intimidation you can use Menacing Approach as a single action with the flourish trait.
Menacing Approach.name: Menacing Approach

Mid-air Tackle.name: Mid-air Tackle
Mid-air Tackle.description:
You launch yourself into the air, wrapping your arms around a flying creature. If you use the 2-action activity, you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d5I6018Mci2SWokk]{Leap} and [[/act grapple options:mid-air-tackle-grapple]] an airborne target. If you use the 3-action activity, you can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2HJ4yuEFY1Cast4h]{High Jump} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} and Grapple an airborne target. Your Grapple gains the following additional effects on success and critical success, depending on the size of the target of your Grapple. If the target is still airborne after a successful Grapple, they add your Bulk value to their capacity to determine whether they are encumbered and if you exceed their maximum Bulk capacity, you both fall and take fall damage. If the target of your Grapple is a willing creature, you treat your degree of success as one better. If you are Flying, you can use Fly instead of High Jump or Long Jump when you use Mid-Air Tackle.

Bring Down (Your size or smaller) The target descends quickly. You and the target both fall 15 feet or 30 feet if your Grapple was a critical success and you remain adjacent to the target as long as they are grabbed. If the target hits the ground, you both take fall damage and fall prone.

Hold On (Your size or larger) You grip to the side of the target and stay in the sky with it. The target does not gain the grabbed or restrained conditions and can continue moving as normal, and you move with it as if you were mounted on the creature. You must attempt to Grapple it each turn to maintain this effect. If the creature successfully Escapes your Grapple, you dismount immediately to a space adjacent to it.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.KxaYlC50zzHysJj8]{Titan Wrestler} skill feat, you can choose to treat your size as one larger when determining the effect of your Mid-Air Tackle, or as two larger if you are legendary in Athletics.

Monastic Practices.name: Monastic Practices
Monastic Practices.description: You have studied in temples and monasteries in lieu of churches and shrines. This has given you a different perspective to faith than some, where repeated obediences like scribing or sacred exercises are more important than preaching or holding mass. When you perform an activity that takes at least 10 minutes, you can make a @Check[religion|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level to find perspective on your fate. If you are successful, you regain a Focus Point. You gain this Focus Point in addition to any focus points you would normally gain as part of performing the activity. You cannot use the Monastic Practices with the Refocus activity.

Monster Zoology.description: You've researched and studied monsters and various creatures that interest you or relate to your fields of expertise, gleaning even more info when you analyze them. When you attempt a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check to Identify a Creature, you can ask an additional question if you are at least expert in the skill you used for your check. If you are a master in the appropriate skill, when you roll a critical failure, you get a failure instead.
Monster Zoology.name: Monster Zoology

prerequisites.value: expert in Crafting, Arcana, Nature, Occultism, Religion or a creature Lore skill

Mountain Carrier.name: Mountain Carrier
Mountain Carrier.description: You can carry utterly impossible weight. Increase your maximum and encumbered Bulk limits by 4 instead of the 2 from Hefty Hauler. In addition, you do not become clumsy 1 from being encumbered and you reduce the penalty to all your Speeds by 5. If you are legendary in Athletics, you increase your maximum and encumbered Bulk limits by 6 instead of 4 and you do not take any penalties to your Speeds from being encumbered.

Multitasking Tamer.name: Multitasking Tamer
Multitasking Tamer.description:
Requirements On your previous turn you successfully used @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.q9nbyIF0PEBqMtYe]{Command an Animal} on an animal you do not control.

Even while taming wild beasts and directing them in combat, you do not allow yourself to let your guard down or get distracted, continuing to act even while performing such commands. You Command an Animal and you automatically succeed at your check to Command an Animal.

Murmured Prayer.name: Murmured Prayer
Murmured Prayer.description: A prayer under your breath to the appropriate god can guide you in times of trouble. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.izcxFQFwf3woCnFs] as a divine innate cantrip. Once per day, you can utter a prayer to a particularly relevant deity as part of casting guidance (such as Cayden Cailean before a Fortitude save to drink alcohol), and the bonus increases to a +2. You do not need to follow the deity to ask for their guidance, but if the deity's goals do not align with your own, they may refuse to aid you (such as Asmodeus denying a revolutionary aid in reading legal papers). If you are legendary in Religion, you can utter a prayer with your guidance once per hour instead of once per day.

No Stone Un-Turned.name: No Stone Un-Turned
No Stone Un-Turned.description:
Frequency once per hour

When you search, you are keen on details that others might overlook the first time you step into a room. The first time you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Search} an area for the day, you can choose roll twice and use the better result between the two. In addition, your eye for peculiarity is constantly at work with or without your focus, so that your Search loses the concentrate trait.

Off-Handed Insult.name: Off-Handed Insult
Off-Handed Insult.description:
Trigger A creature affected by your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.0GF2j54roPFIDmXf]{Bon Mot} attempts a skill action to end the effect.

When someone attempts a retort, your snide remarks can often impede their actions. The triggering check takes a -2 status penalty as you insult them in sequence.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.MgkrjauDYsZBNQm8]{Effect: Off-Handed Insult}

Organization Infiltrator.name: Organization Infiltrator
Organization Infiltrator.description:
You spend a day of downtime carefully observing activities, practicing mannerisms, and collecting equipment of an organization, faction, or specific group of people (such as the aristocrats of a particular country) so you can better pretend you are one of them. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} a member from this group.

In addition, when you are using Impersonate as a member of this group and your allies @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.tfa4Sh7wcxCEqL29]{Follow the Expert}, you and those allies can choose to roll a single Deception check, using the lowest modifier, instead of rolling separately, applying your circumstance bonus to Impersonate to the check. This doesn't apply for initiative rolls.

This bonus can only apply to a single group at a time, though you can spend a day of downtime observing a new group, losing your previous bonus to Impersonate to the previous group and gaining it for the new group.

Pacifying Proposal.name: Pacifying Proposal
Pacifying Proposal.description:
Trigger An ally creature attempts to Coerce a creature you can see and hear.

You juxtapose yourself as the nice one among your allies. Make a @Check[type:diplomacy] check against the DC of the triggering activity. On success, the triggering Coerce activity does not cause the creature's attitude to change, though they still might retaliate or report you to the authorities. On a critical success, they will not retaliate, and they see the proposal as mutually beneficial, believing the triggering ally means well despite their lack of tact. Regardless of your outcome, the target of the Coerce activity becomes immune to your Pacifying Proposal for 1 week.

Parley with Celestials.description: You have learned how to present yourself in an appropriate manner when dealing with all manners of celestial, making you feel far more trustworthy. Unless you are intentionally presenting yourself differently, celestials will assume you are holy or serve benevolent deities. Celestials have a -2 circumstance penalty on their Perception DC against you, and celestials your level or lower do not detect unholy sanctification, even with magic, unless they also succeed at a @Check[perception|against:religion|rollerRole:target] check against your Religion DC.
Parley with Celestials.name: Parley with Celestials

Peace with Death.name: Peace with Death
Peace with Death.description:
You have studied faith long enough to be prepared for what waits after death, and you are not frightened by the afterlife. You spend 10 minutes uttering prayers or other conformations of faith and then attempt a @Check[religion|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level. Regardless of the result, you are temporarily immune to Peace with Death for 1 hour.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.3DrxNxi9Xdd513ji]{Effect: Peace with Death}

Critical Success The first time you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition within the next hour, you reduce the DC of your Recovery Checks by 5 for as long as you have the dying condition. In addition, if you regain Hit Points while you have this dying condition, you increase the number of Hit Points gained by your level.

Success As critical success, except the number of additional Hit Points you regain is equal to half your level.

Planar Pedagogy.name: Planar Pedagogy
Planar Pedagogy.description: The study of the planes is not an uncommon one across wizard schools on Golarion or other esteemed places of learning. Understanding their influence on the Universe and the ways they connect can serve as important knowledge while adventuring. By spending [[/r 1d4]] hours studying the planes and attempting an @Check[type:arcana|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level, you become trained in a Lore skill for a specific plane for 1 day. You can change which planar lore you are trained in by spending another 1d4 hours studying to switch it. You can only be trained in one Lore skill from this feat at a time and you must have suitable access to research materials to use this activity. If you are a master in Arcana, you instead gain expert proficiency in this Lore, and if you are legendary in Arcana, you instead gain master proficiency in this Lore.

Plaster Physician.name: Plaster Physician
Plaster Physician.description: Having practiced using natural remedies & materials for medicinal purposes, you have obtained a supernatural ability to harness some of nature's magic to meet your needs. You can cast 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.m5QS8q5M6K0euKcT] at will as a primal innate spell and can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.WC4xLBGmBsdOdHWu]{Natural Medicine} with the tools you created. If you're a master in Nature, the spell is heightened to 3rd rank and you gain the item bonus to your Nature checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds}. If you're legendary in Nature, casting healing plaster counts as having access to fresh ingredients for the purposes of triggering Natural Medicine's circumstance bonus.

Prepare the Plans.name: Prepare the Plans
Prepare the Plans.description:
In preparation for a grand job, you arrange meetings with local thieves and fences, gather information, and take smaller requests in the vicinity of your target. You spend a week of downtime preparing. The GM rolls a secret @Check[thievery] check for you, usually against a standard DC of the settlement's level or a DC relevant to the target location or organization (for example, the average guard's perception DC, or a standard DC for the level of the head of the organization), but the GM may adjust the DC for particularly harsh circumstances.

Critical Success If during the next month, you attempt an Infiltration against the target location or organization, you call upon your contacts and bring out your resources. The GM immediately offers you two infiltration preparation activities to do.

Success As critical success, but the GM only offers one such activity.

Critical Failure The target has been tipped off! You begin the infiltration with 1 Awareness Point.

Quick Cuisine.name: Quick Cuisine
Quick Cuisine.description:
Adventurers can't fight on an empty stomach! You invigorate a companion by whipping up a quick meal for them during your journeys. You spend 10 minutes setting up a basic cooking setup to prepare your meal and choose one ally to feed and attempt a Cooking Lore check against a standard DC of the ally's level. The effects of this Quick Cuisine lasts for 1 hour. If you are a master in Cooking Lore, you can prepare a meal for two allies in the same 10 minutes, and if you are legendary in Cooking Lore you can prepare a meal for four allies in the same 10 minutes. You must use the highest level among your allies for determining the standard DC of Quick Cuisine. After a creature eats the food made from your Quick Cuisine, they are immune to its effects until your next daily preparations.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.F7MX2YhI0mMy3aGG]{Effect: Quick Cuisine}

Critical Success The dish is flavorful and filling! The ally who eats the meal receives a +1 circumstance bonus to their next Fortitude save or a +2 circumstance bonus if the effect would give them the sickened condition. The target gains a number of temporary Hit Points equal to half your level plus your Intelligence modifier.

Success As critical success, but the creature does not gain temporary Hit Points.

Failure The dish is perfectly average and lacking in outstanding flavor. The creature gains the effects normal for consuming food.

Critical Failure The dish is absolutely rancid and gives your ally a stomachache! The ally who eats the meal receives a –2 circumstance bonus to their next Fortitude save until your next daily preparations.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.1Eceqc6zbMj2x0q9]{Seasoned} feat, you benefit from the circumstance bonus to perform the Quick Cuisine action in addition to its regular effects.

Quick Learner.name: Quick Learner
Quick Learner.description: You pick up new skills or abilities quickly. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.24PSsn1SKpUwYA1X]{Retrain} something that would normally require a week to Retrain, you can expedite your learning process to do so in 1 day. The cost and requirements (such as access to a trainer or spellbook with the spell) of the activity remain the same. When you Retrain in this way, you cannot do so again for 1 week, though you can still spend the normal amount of time to Retrain during this time.

Quick Stabilization.name: Quick Stabilization
Quick Stabilization.description: The faster you bring a dying creature out of danger, the better. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to stabilize a creature, you require only a single action to Administer First Aid.

Recognize Liar.name: Recognize Liar
Recognize Liar.description: You know what liars do because you are one. You always use your Deception DC against creatures that attempt to Lie to you or others in your presence, no longer needing to engage in conversation. In addition, you can use your Deception DC instead of your Perception DC for detecting forgeries if they are attempting to Impersonate a specific creature's work and you can use your Deception DC instead of your Perception DC against attempts to Create a Diversion, Impersonate, or Feint.

Reflexive Cover.name: Reflexive Cover
Reflexive Cover.description:
Trigger You would roll a Reflex save against an area effect and are not prone.

You lunge out of the way, ducking for cover even if it is not readily available to you. You make an Acrobatics check against the DC of the triggering effect. If you succeed, you gain lesser cover against the triggering effect and then fall prone, or standard cover if you got a critical success. If you are near an object you could normally use to Take Cover to gain cover against the effect, you can choose not to fall prone.

Remote Removal.name: Remote Removal
Remote Removal.description: You don't even need to be present to take something. Your study of magic allows you to instinctively sense its presence. You can cast 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w] at will as an arcane innate spell. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object} as part of the Cast a Spell activity for your telekinetic hand so long as the object you are lifting ends its movement adjacent to you.

Restricting Flora.name: Restricting Flora
Restricting Flora.description:
Requirements You are in an area of natural terrain.

You beckon and whisper to the plants around you, invoking them to bind and restrict your foes movements. Attempt a @Check[type:nature|defense:reflex] check against the Reflex DC of a creature within 30 feet of you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.oGtY2OY4sp40eW0M]{Effect: Restricting Flora}

Critical Success The target creature takes a -10-foot status penalty to its Speed until the end of your next turn.

Success As critical success, but the creature takes a -5-foot status penalty to its Speed.

Critical Failure Your failed attempt to harness the natural plant life around you backfires, causing you to become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] until the end of your next turn.

Return to the Sea.name: Return to the Sea
Return to the Sea.description: You survived the terrible machinations of the alghollthu, whether by directly facing them or coming close to death against their minions such as the faceless stalkers or the skum. The encounter left you scarred, physically, mentally and genetically. You gain the amphibious trait. When in contact with bodies of water, your appearance changes dramatically, becoming fish-like. You gain a swim Speed equal to your land Speed, and can breathe water as well as air. However, you are permanently @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} in this form.

prerequisites.value: You came into direct contact with the experimentation of the alghollthu

Revitalizing Grove.name: Revitalizing Grove
Revitalizing Grove.description:
Requirements You are in an area of natural terrain.

Through communing with the environment and drawing upon the natural life around you, you create an area of healing energy. You spend 10 minutes utilizing old prayers and teachings to manipulate your environment, creating a @Template[type:burst|distance:10] of energy that lasts for 1 minute. Attempt a @Check[type:nature|dc:30] check. If the area of natural terrain is in poor condition or lacking in natural life, the DC may be increased under GM discretion. If you are legendary in Nature, you can choose to increase the DC to a @Check[type:nature|dc:40] check to double the amount of fast healing.

Critical Success Allies in the area gain fast healing 5 while they remain in the area.

Success As critical success, but the fast healing is 2.

Failure Nothing happens.

Rippling Roar.name: Rippling Roar
Rippling Roar.description: Your battle cry carries far and wide, affecting the whole battlefield. When you use your reaction to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} due to a critical success on an attack roll, you compare the result to all Will DCs of foes within 30 feet instead of just the target of your attack roll.

Rumor Has It.name: Rumor Has It
Rumor Has It.description: The rumors you create persist for twice the amount of time they usually last. Each time you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.sLEawQueTV1wGn0B]{Sow a Rumor}, the GM also makes a secret @Check[type:flat|traits:secret|dc:18]; If your flat check is successful, the rumor you created becomes established gossip or urban legend, lasting 1 year when you get a success on Sow Rumor, or indefinitely if your result on Sow Rumor was a critical success. Most NPCs exposed to the rumor take it to be true, unless they critically succeed a Gather Information or Recall Knowledge check against your Deception DC. Creatures with intimate knowledge of the subject of the rumor treat their degree of success as one better. Any attempts to dispel your rumors must succeed against your Deception DC in addition to any checks associated with spreading information counter to your rumor, such as attempts to Make an Impression or a Request to a local authority to issue a statement. If you are legendary in Deception, the DC of the flat check is 15 instead of 18 (@Check[type:flat|traits:secret|dc:15]).

Safe Spell.name: Safe Spell
Safe Spell.description:
As a spellcaster, you know all too well how easy it can be to accidentally harm allies with a bit of magical friendly fire, and you've learned to protect them from such things. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with no duration, that deals damage, and has an area, you can designate 2 allies to exclude from the spell's effect.

At 10th level, and every 4 levels thereafter, you can exclude an additional ally from the area of the spell.

Salvage Infiltration.name: Salvage Infiltration
Salvage Infiltration.description:
You're exceptionally practiced when it comes to sneaking into places you shouldn't be in, allowing you to recover even when you're about to be detected. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your checks during infiltrations, or a +2 if the check was a Stealth check.

Additionally, once per day, when you or your allies would accrue Awareness Points due to an obstacle or complication, you can use your reaction to smooth things out, avoiding the Awareness Point increase (but not any other effects).

Sancitifed Layman.name: Sancitifed Layman
Sancitifed Layman.description: Though not an official member of the clergy, your dedication to your deity, your readings of sacred texts and your actions in the name of your religion have earned you divine attention. You and your Strikes become sanctified by your deity, gaining the holy or unholy traits. You must choose a sanctification that your deity would allow for its clerics.

Savory Socialization.description: A delicious meal transcends the boundaries of language to forge strong connections. You can use Cooking Lore instead of Diplomacy to [[/act make-an-impression skill=cooking-lore]]{Make an Impression (Cooking Lore)} by creating a delicious meal over the course of 10 minutes. You can do this even with creatures that you don't share a language with, provided they partakeinyourmeal.You can perform this activity ahead of time to prepare a meal, allowing you to Make an Impression in the normal amount of time instead of 10 minutes, but you must specify which creature or creatures the meal is for or you take a –4 circumstance penalty to your check.
Savory Socialization.name: Savory Socialization

Seeking Spell.name: Seeking Spell
Seeking Spell.description:
Frequency once per hour

You infuse incredible accuracy into your next spell, causing it to strike true against foes who are protected by cover. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell with an attack roll, you reduce the circumstance bonus to target's AC from cover by 2.

Additionally, if your spell attack roll is a failure, but not a critical failure, the spell does not end immediately, but instead you can Sustain this effect on your next turn to attempt this spell attack roll again. At 14th level and every 2 levels after, you can Sustain this effect an additional round to attempt the attack roll again instead of only your next turn, but you can only attempt one additional attack roll for this effect per round.

Sense Scopophobia.name: Sense Scopophobia
Sense Scopophobia.description: Even while hiding, you watch your prey intently, looking for any telltale reflexive movements to know when the jig is up. As long as you can see a creature, you are aware whether you're unnoticed, undetected, hidden, or observed by them. In addition, you can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} as a free action if your intent is to learn whether a creature is pretending not to notice you.

Shared Spellshaping.name: Shared Spellshaping
Shared Spellshaping.description:
Requirements Your partner can cast spells.

You and your partner share the secrets of spellshaping with one another. Choose one spellshape action you can use and your partner chooses one spellshape action which they can use, if any. While employing this teamwork, if you are within 15 feet of each other, you can use each other's chosen spellshape action. If a chosen spellshape action has a requirement, both you and your partner are subject to the requirements and if it has a frequency, the frequency applies to both of you.

prerequisites.value: you have at least one action with the spellshape trait

Skill Expertise.name: Skill Expertise
Skill Expertise.description:
You develop expertise in a skill. You become expert in a skill of your choice that you are trained in.

Special You can select this feat up to 3 times, choosing a new skill to become expert in each time.

Slap on the Wrist.name: Slap on the Wrist
Slap on the Wrist.description:
You know how to get yourself out of trouble with the law, even if you have clearly broken them. Whenever you take an action or activity that breaks local law and customs and are caught, you can spend 1 minute to Make an Impression and you can use your [[/act make-an-impression skill=deception]]{Deception} instead of Diplomacy for this Make an Impression and the action or activity does not change their attitude toward you unless you fail your attempt to Make an Impression.

If you include your allies in the story, you can target up to 5 allies to be included in the effects of your Make an Impression, but you take a -2 penalty to your Make an Impression. If you target a group of individuals and there are mixed results within a group, usually the highest ranking authority in the group makes the decision (subject to GM discretion, but usually the highest level creature).

If after you Make an Impression the targets are friendly towards you or one of your allies, they might be skeptical of your story but give you the benefit of the doubt, but they may still ask that you leave the premises or other reasonable expectations. If the target is helpful towards you or one of your allies, they will treat your actions as if they were lawful as you've convinced them of your circumstances, and they may even aid you in your endeavor unknowing of your intentions.

Slink Away.name: Slink Away
Slink Away.description: You cloak yourself in the shadows that embrace you. Choose a single creature observing you. You immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} in a direction away from the chosen creature. You are treated as having cover for your Hide and Sneak against that creature and if you succeed at your Stealth to become hidden, you are still treated as having cover for your Hide and Sneak actions until the beginning of your next turn for the creature you chose. If you use any action except Step, Sneak, or Hide before the beginning of your next turn, you immediately lose these effects. You must move at least 10 feet away from the creature you chose when you Sneak or you immediately become observed again after your movement. Regardless of the results of your Hide and Sneak, the creature you chose cannot be targeted by Slink Away again for 1 minute.

Slip the Grip.name: Slip the Grip
Slip the Grip.description:
Trigger You are about to roll a Reflex save against an effect that would make you immobilized.

When you botch the job, you know how to use professionalism to save your hide. Attempt the triggering saving throw using Thievery instead of your Reflex save.

Slope Slide.name: Slope Slide
Slope Slide.description:
With knees bent and hands splayed, you allow gravity to bring you down slopes quickly, be they hills, banisters or roofs. When you move down a slope, you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Bcxarzksqt9ezrs6]{Stride} and attempt an Acrobatics check depending on the sheerness of the slope (subject to GM discretion). The type of slope varies based on incline and the material, but usually at least a single diagonal is required to provide the effects of a slope. The GM might adjust a slope depending on its shape or substance, such as an icy surface or a steep set of stairs. You cannot attempt to use Slope Slide on a severe slope unless you are at least a master in Acrobatics.

Gentle Slope You move slightly more than expected. At the end of your Stride, make an @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:@self.level|showDC:owner|adjustment:-2|options:action:slope-slide:gentle-slope] check against an easy DC for your level. On a success, you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.UHpkTuCtyaPqiCAB]{Step}.

Moderate Slope The momentum of your movement swings you forward. At the end of your Stride, make an @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:@self.level|showDC:owner|options:action:slope-slide:moderate-slope] check against a standard DC for your level. On a success, you move an additional 10 feet and if your next action is to make a melee Strike against a creature, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your attack roll.

Severe Slope You move at breakneck speeds towards your opponent. At the end of your Stride, make an @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:@self.level|showDC:owner|adjustment:+2|options:action:slope-slide:severe-slope] check against a hard DC for your level. You gain the effects of a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.JUvAvruz7yRQXfz2]{Long Jump} with the same tier of success as your result at the end of your Stride and if your next action is to make a melee Strike against a creature, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your attack roll.

Special If you have the panache class feature, this action gains the bravado trait when you attempt to use it with a moderate or severe slope.

Smash Obstacles.name: Smash Obstacles
Smash Obstacles.description: A lock means nothing to you. You do not take a circumstance penalty for not having a crowbar when you Force Open. In addition, when you critically fail to Force Open, you get a regular failure instead.

Smokescreens.name: Smokescreens
Smokescreens.description: You come prepared to slither away under the cover of smoke should the tides turn for worse. You gain the formula for smoke balls and can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} smoke balls using your Stealth instead of Crafting. During your daily preparations, you can create one l@UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.MoBlVd36uD9xVvZC]{esser smoke ball} that remains usable until your next daily preparations, deteriorating when you make your daily preparations again. If you are at least an expert in Stealth, you can create two lesser smoke balls, or four lesser smoke balls if you are a master. If you are a legendary, you can choose to prepare one @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ehss8yPTXxiUdVlJ]{greater smoke ball} instead of two lesser smokeballs when you create your smoke balls during your daily preparations.

Social Intuition.name: Social Intuition
Social Intuition.description: You read people's intent as you speak to them. When you succeed at a Diplomacy check to Make an Impression or Request, you can immediately attempt a Sense Motive using [[/act sense-motive skill=diplomacy]]{Diplomacy} instead of Perception on the target of your Make an Impression or Request. If you choose to use Perception, you instead gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your check. If you are a master in Diplomacy, the circumstance bonus increases to +2.

Solitary Workforce.name: Solitary Workforce
Solitary Workforce.description:
You work more efficiently than even a dozen of your peers. For any activity that requires the physical labor of multiple creatures to do, you count as two creatures, rolling a single check and using the result to determine the effects of each participant you would replace. If you're an expert in Labor Lore, you count as four creatures, if you're a master in Labor Lore you count as six creatures, and if you're legendary, you count as eight creatures. If you use Labor Lore to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, you treat the task level as one higher for the purposes of currency earned, two highe r if you are a master, or four higher if you are legendary.

In addition, when you successfully Earn Income with Labor Lore, you get the effects of a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on any creatures you worked with or for during the activity if it was your first time interacting with them with the same degree of success as your check.

Specialty Master.name: Specialty Master
Specialty Master.description: Though you might not be familiar with certain techniques, it does not stop you from crafting an item you specialize in. You always apply your full circumstance bonus to Craft items that would involve your selected specialty instead of partial. You also apply your circumstance bonus from Specialty Crafting to any Crafting checks you make on items that would fall under your specialty, not just to the Craft activity.

Specialty Repair.name: Specialty Repair
Specialty Repair.description: Your focus on crafting a specific type of item means you're also extra adept at repairing said item. You can use an item related to your specialty from Specialty Crafting in the Repair of another object by increasing the Crafting DC to repair by 2. If you do, you can reduce the item you used for the Repair's Hit Points by up to twice your level and increase the amount of Hit Points restored to the Repaired object by the same amount.

Spell-Signature Reading.name: Spell-Signature Reading

prerequisites.value: trained in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, Religion, or Scribing Lore

Spell-Signature Reading.description:
Whenever any caster performs magic, no matter how meager, it creates a vibrant display of runes circling around an intricate glyph known as a spell signature. As a learned student of the arcane yourself, you know all too well what information can be gleaned from such runes, such as one's personality or skill level with magic. You learn if the creature is casting the spell as a spontaneous, prepared, or innate spellcaster, if they can cast spells from spell slots, and what attribute they use to cast spells. If a creature can cast a spell from multiple sources such as having innate spells and prepared spells both, you learn both.

Special If you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.MjQyTcV8Jiv1Jtln]{Recognize Spell} feat, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to all checks to Recognize Spells from a creature that you successfully used Spell-Signature Reading against.

Spiritual Memories.name: Spiritual Memories
Spiritual Memories.description:
You open your mind to the influence of spirits and use their memories to guide you, assisting you in tasks you are otherwise unfamiliar with. Choose one skill, you become trained in that skill for 1 minute. If you are legendary in Occultism, you can choose to become an expert in the skill instead of trained or a master in a skill in which you were at least trained.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.ReoCfS6GaVRfkdNw]{Effect: Spiritual Memories (Trained)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.PpYMH7xp3RHn7A09]{Effect: Spiritual Memories (Expert)}

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.z1mcBkK5ucZYFhYa]{Effect: Spiritual Memories (Master)}

Sprint.name: Sprint
Sprint.description:
Requirements You are not fatigued.

You can push yourself to run much faster than normal in a pinch. Stride in a straight line and make an @Check[type:athletics|dc:resolve(15 + (5 * @actor.flags.pf2e-feats-plus.sprintCount))] check. You can use Sprint to Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim instead of Stride if you have the corresponding movement type.

Critical Success As success, except you do not increase the DC of Sprint.

Success You treat your Speed as if it were 5 feet greater for your Stride and increase the DC of Sprint by 5 until you spend 10 minutes resting.

Critical Failure You pushed yourself too hard. You are fatigued and have a -10 status penalty to your Speeds until you rest for 10 minutes.

Foundry Note You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.kJerV6IsiEEZoBlL]{Effect: Sprint Count} to represent how many times you have used this action so far.

Starvation Prevention.name: Starvation Prevention
Starvation Prevention.description:
Your medical training informed you of how to survive when you have a limited amount of food available. You can use Medicine instead of Society or Survival to [[/act subsist skill=medicine]] by leveraging nuances in nutrition delivery and various other techniques to suppress the bodies' needs for nutrients. When you Subsist in this way, the next time you Subsist using Medicine you treat your degree of success as one worse.

Alternatively, you can choose to help another creature using Subsist by making a Medicine check against the same DC. If you get a success, you increase their degree of success by one step, or by two steps if you get a critical success.

Staunch Bleeding.name: Staunch Bleeding
Staunch Bleeding.description:
Frequency Once per round

You know how to pack an injury properly to stop bleeding. You use Staunch Bleeding as a single action or as a 2-action activity with the following effects.

1 You use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to stop bleeding.

2 You use Administer First Aid to stop bleeding and you reduce the DC of the check by 10.

Steal It All.name: Steal It All
Steal It All.description:
You make a mad dash, pocketing anything you can. You Stride. As part of your Stride, you Interact to pick up an item, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} and then immediately Interact to stow the item.

If you spend three actions doing this activity, you may spend 2 actions to Interact to pick up an item, Palm an Object, or Steal and you immediately Interact to stow the item after each action.

Steal Senses.name: Steal Senses
Steal Senses.description:
Your fingers are so deft that you know the exact spots to press in order to rob a target of their very senses. Attempt a @Check[thievery|against:reflex] check against the Reflex DC of a creature within your reach. Regardless of the result, the target is then immune to your Steal Senses for 1 day.

Critical Success The target becomes your choice of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.XgEqL1kFApUbl5Z2]{Blinded} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.9PR9y0bi4JPKnHPR]{Deafened} for [[/r 1d4 #Rounds]] rounds. If the creature has a sense other than sight or hearing, such as tremorsense, you can instead negate that sense. The creature can spend a single action that has the concentrate trait to remove these conditions or restore their lost senses.

Success As critical success, but the duration is until the end of the target's next turn.

Critical Failure The target prevents your theft with prejudice. You are off-guard and cannot take reactions for 1 round.

Stunning Desensitivity.name: Stunning Desensitivity
Stunning Desensitivity.description:
Trigger You would gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.dfCMdR4wnpbYNTix]{Stunned} condition with a value from a non-mental effect.

You practice pain management, giving you higher cognitive ability when subjected to pain. Attempt a @Check[survival] check against the DC of the triggering effect if it had a DC, or a standard DC of the hazard or creature's level if it did not have a DC.

Critical Success You reduce the value of the stunned condition you would get by 2.

Success As critical success, except you reduce the value by 1.

Critical Failure You lean in too hard, increasing your stunned value by 1.

Subliminal Messages.name: Subliminal Messages
Subliminal Messages.description:
You read out a written passage of text, trying out different emphasis to decipher any hidden meaning or context you can interpret from the writing. You can use Performance to [[/act decipher-writing skill=performance]] if the text you are attempting to decipher is a work of art, such as a song, limerick, or poem.

You can also create messages with hidden meanings in them, using Performance in place of Deception or other skills to create the message by placing them in a work of art. A creature must make a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1xRFPTFtWtGJ9ELw]{Sense Motive} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d9gbpiQjChYDYA2L]{Decipher Writing} check against your Performance DC in order to decipher your meaning. Creatures that are familiar with you or your artistic styles gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their check.

Subsistive Tracker.name: Subsistive Tracker
Subsistive Tracker.description: You have learned how to follow a trail while sustaining yourself. When you use downtime to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.49y9Ec4bDii8pcD3]{Subsist} your GM automatically compares the result of your Survival check against the DC to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EA5vuSgJfiHH7plD]{Track} the tracks of creatures you would uncover while you Subsist.

Surveillant Senses.name: Surveillant Senses
Surveillant Senses.description: Your senses are highly tuned and sensitive. If you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}, you become hyper aware of your surroundings until the beginning of your next turn. If a creature attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} while within 30 feet of you during this time, your GM attempts a secret Perception check for you and uses the result or your Perception DC, whichever is higher, against any target's attempts to Sneak or Hide from you.

Survivalist's Cartography.description:
Asyoutraveloverlandandexploredungeons,youcreate maps of the locations you travel, allowing you to assist your allies in exploring safely without getting lost. You can use Cartography Lore instead of Survival to [[/act sense-direction skill=cartography-lore]]{Sense Direction (Cartography Lore)} and you can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.UhcRWtnjU2WLSClx]{Survey Maps} using Cartography Lore instead of Crafting. When you Craft a Survey Map with Cartography Lore, it takes you only 1 day and you reduce the cost to create Survey Maps to half the normal amount.

In addition, if you successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on an area you are currently in, you can spend 10 minutes scribing an impromptu map of the area, granting a +2 circumstance bonus to Sense Direction while within the area and to Perception to detect secret doors or passageways if the area would have noticeable structural inconsistencies.
Survivalist's Cartography.name: Survivalist's Cartography

Swindle.name: Swindle
Swindle.description:
You use sleight-of-hand or charming words to distract someone into miscalculating how much you actually paid them. When paying someone (for example, the price for an item in a shop, or a bribe), you can choose to not pay fully–how much you can save is determined by Earn Income, using your proficiency in Thievery, and the creature's level you are attempting to swindle as the Task Level. If you do, attempt a Thievery check against the Perception DC of the creature you are paying. If multiple creatures are present when you pay the creature, your @Check[thievery|against:perception] check is against the highest Perception DC creature that would oppose your attempts to Swindle (such as a guard or the creature's ally).

Regardless of the result, the target's Perception DC against your further Swindle attempts increases by 5 for 1 week as they inevitably realize they're coming up short on money. The GM decides if and how the target retaliates after repeated attempts to swindle it and its response to a critical failure (usually by alerting authorities).

Critical Success Your trick goes unnoticed. You can save up to twice the value described above, but always at most half the amount you would have had to pay.

Success As critical success, but you can only save up to the value described above, and still at most half the amount you would have had to pay.

Failure The target notices the missing amount, but you brush it off as a mistake. You pay the full amount.

Critical Failure The target not only notices the missing amount, but knows you intentionally tried to swindle it. If there was an expected exchange of goods for your payment, it refuses to honor the exchange.

Take What's Needed.name: Take What's Needed
Take What's Needed.description: When you hunt, you do so for a purpose. Select an animal or beast that was slain within the last 8 hours. You can use the creature's remnants for raw materials, allowing you to treat items you or another creature attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} as if they had the formula of a piece of common or uncommon adventuring gear. The item level can be no higher than half your level. Your GM may rule that only certain creatures can provide the effects of having a formula for certain items (like slaying an amphibian and using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.is3Oz9wt11lNq62K]{Alchemical Crafting} to make @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.5KobTMrZeZxuXMgl] elixir).

Talisman Crafter.name: Talisman Crafter
Talisman Crafter.description: The magical potential contained within talismans is a major boon to any adventurer wise enough to use them, and you have developed a knack for their creation using your occult knowledge. When you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} an item with the talisman trait, you may roll Occultism in place of Crafting. If you use Occultism to Craft, your Occultism proficiency is used for determining what level items you can craft as though it were the Crafting skill. Additionally, when you select this feat, you gain the formulas for four common talismans of 2nd level or lower and you can Craft talismans even if you do not have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.xWY5omyIcILNR7y1]{Magical Crafting}.

prerequisites.value: You have at least one feat with the Teamwork trait

Team Player.description:
Trigger Your turn begins.

You instinctively work together with allies, rushing into the fray together and switching partners. You use a single action with the teamwork trait.
Team Player.name: Team Player

Teamwork Talent.name: Teamwork Talent
Teamwork Talent.description: You're a natural talent when it comes to working alongside others in combat. You obtain one 1st- or 2nd-level feat with the teamwork trait.

Tell Fortune.name: Tell Fortune
Tell Fortune.description: Whether through harrow cards, palm-reading, star-reading or some other method of divining the future, you are able to predict the futures of other people surprisingly well. You can spend 1 hour telling someone else's fortune. Attempt a Fortune-Telling Lore check against a hard DC of a target creature's level, producing the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury} on a success with regards to the creature's future. Regardless of the result, the creature is then immune to your Tell Fortune for 1 week.

Tenacious Tosser.name: Tenacious Tosser
Tenacious Tosser.description:
You've always been told you have a good throwing arm and you know how to make the most of it! When you use the Interact action to pass off or take an item to an ally, you may increase the range you can throw to a 20-foot increment.

You can choose to give your Interact the flourish trait, allowing you to draw an item out of your bag that is 1 bulk or less and pass it off or give it to an ally, rolling to throw as normal.

The End Times are Coming!.name: The End Times are Coming!
The End Times are Coming!.description:
You know how to strike fear and panic into everyone with doomsaying and warnings of divine retribution, even if you don't believe them yourself. Make a @Check[religion|against:will] check against the Will DC of all creatures of a specific faith within 30 feet. You must choose which faith as part of using this action. All creatures in the area, even those of another faith, are then temporarily immune for 1 hour.

Critical Success The target becomes @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and its frightened condition cannot be reduced below 1 until it spends a single action praying.

Success As critical success, except the target is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 1}.

Critical Failure You bolster the faith of those you chastise, and they gain a +1 status bonus to their next hostile action against you for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.B0S2JmP30C0Mh5om]{Effect: The End Times are Coming!}

The Show Must Go On.name: The Show Must Go On
The Show Must Go On.description:
Frequency Once per day

Your performances demand they be finished. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{Perform} against a very hard DC of your level. If you succeed, your performance is so triumphant that it cannot be stopped, not even by death. Until the beginning of your next turn, if you are reduced to 0 Hit Points, you avoid falling unconscious and remain at 1 Hit Point. Each time you would be reduced to 0 Hit Points, you increase your @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.Yl48xTdMh3aeQYL2] value by 1. You can Sustain this performance on subsequent turns to prolong this effect, but if your wounded value reaches your maximum dying value, you die instantly.

Theological Academic.name: Theological Academic
Theological Academic.description: You know the prose and language often included in theological writings very well, and can consume such pieces quickly. When you use Religion to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d9gbpiQjChYDYA2L]{Decipher Writing}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.t5nBkpjroaq7QBGK]{Research} or otherwise gain knowledge from texts that require a Religion roll, you can perform the activity in half the normal amount of time and if you get a critical failure, you get a failure instead.

Think Tank.name: Think Tank
Think Tank.description:
Requirements You are within 30 feet of your partner and can both @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Recall Knowledge]{Recall Knowledge} against an enemy in the current encounter.

You huddle together with a fellow sophist, arguing whatever matters come to mind. While employing this teamwork, when either of you Recalls Knowledge you both roll the check and use the higher result between you. This is a fortune effect.

prerequisites.value: trained in at least one skill with the Recall Knowledge action

Tighten Hold.name: Tighten Hold
Tighten Hold.description:
Requirements You have a creature grabbed or restrained.

You lock in around your target and squeeze harder, anchoring them into your inescapable grasp. Attempt an Athletics check against the creature's Fortitude DC.

Critical Success Your grip cannot be broken. The creature receives a -3 circumstance penalty to Escape until the start of your next turn.

Success As a critical success, but the penalty is a -2.

Critical Failure The creature is no longer grabbed or restrained.

Timely Trivia.name: Timely Trivia
Timely Trivia.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet would attempt to Recall Knowledge during an encounter.

As a fount of boundless yet situational knowledge, you bring up a possibly useful fact during an opportune moment. You use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} for the triggering ally's check using the prerequisite skill and you do not need to have spent a preparatory action to Aid in this way.

prerequisites.value: expert in Academia Lore, Arcana, or Occultism

To Know a Thief.name: To Know a Thief
To Know a Thief.description: Using your experience in the field, you know the best way to capture your fellow ne'er-do-wells. You can use Thievery to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} manacles, locks, and handcuffs, including using your higher proficiency for what items you can Craft. You gain a formula book and you immediately add the formulas for manacles, locks, and handcuffs to your formula book. In addition, you can build in fail safes for your own manacles, locks, and handcuffs which provide you or creatures aware of your fail safes to treat their degrees of success to Disable, Pick, or Escape them as one better.

Top Out.name: Top Out
Top Out.description: You have learned to use momentum to kick your way atop obstacles and land on both feet. You can use [[/act climb skill:acrobatics]]{Acrobatics} to Climb instead of Athletics.

Trade of the Trade.name: Trade of the Trade
Trade of the Trade.description: You have a keen understanding of market trends, price fluctuations, and trade practices. You can use Society when haggling or bartering with merchants. You can also use Society to determine the value of goods for sale, and may use Society in place of a skill associated with a magic tradition to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} on magic items for sale, though not on any other sorts of magic or item.

Trained Stomach.name: Trained Stomach
Trained Stomach.description: You have devised methods for suppressing illness. You can use your Survival instead of Fortitude when you retch to attempt to remove the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.fesd1n5eVhpCSS18]{Sickened} condition. If you are a master in Survival, you can willingly ingest while you have the sickened condition.

Transmute Spell.name: Transmute Spell

prerequisites.value: ability to cast spells from spell slots

Transmute Spell.description:
Frequency once per minute

Transmuting forms of magical energy is child's play to you. When you use this action, choose one of the following essences below, corresponding to your main spellcasting tradition. If a spell deals multiple damage types, change all damage types that meet the requirements.

Matter (Arcane or Primal) If your next action is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots that deals physical damage and doesn't have a duration, you can change the damage type to acid, cold, electricity or fire damage.

Mind (Arcane or Occult) If your next action is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots that deals energy damage and doesn't have a duration, you can change the damage type to mental, and the target takes additional mental damage equal to the spell's rank.

Spirit (Occult or Divine) If your next action is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots that deals physical damage and doesn't have a duration, you can change the damage type to spirit, and this spirit damage only damages creatures with a weakness to holy, spirit, or unholy.

Life (Divine or Primal) If your next action is to Cast a Spell from your spell slots that deals energy damage and doesn't have a duration, you can change the damage type to vitality or void.

Undead Ètudiant.name: Undead Ètudiant
Undead Ètudiant.description: You've come to study the undead quite closely, learning how the instinctual behavior of the mindless works and why the hungers of those with minds affect them the way they do. You learn Necril as a bonus language, or another language if you already know Necril. You can roll Religion to [[/act make-an-impression skill=religion]] or [[/act request skill=religion]] things of undead, even if the undead is mindless. In the case of mindless undead, you attempt these checks against a standard DC of the creature's level.

Uninhibited Aid.name: Uninhibited Aid
