Uninhibited Aid.description: Aiding your allies comes so naturally to you that you do so reflexively.The first time each turn you spend at least one action to prepare to Aid an ally, you gain an additional reaction that can be used only for the Aid reaction until the beginning of your next turn.

Unmistakable Creatures.name: Unmistakable Creatures

prerequisites.value: expert in a Lore of a creature or creature type

Unmistakable Creatures.description: You never confuse the creature you know of for another, nor do you confuse other creatures for it. When you critically fail to Recall Knowledge on a Lore for a creature or creature type, you get a failure instead. If another creature attempts to disguise itself as the creature of a Lore you are at least trained, you gain a +4 circumstance bonus to see through the disguise. When you become a master in a Lore for a creature or creature type, a creature must attempt a separate Deception check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} against your Lore DC in addition to your Perception DC, gaining the circumstance bonus to see through disguises to your Lore DC as well.

Unpredictable Diversion.name: Unpredictable Diversion
Unpredictable Diversion.description: You create a truly unpredictable diversion, throwing your enemies way off. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.GkmbTGfg8KcgynOA]{Create a Diversion}. If you get a success, your hidden condition does not end until the beginning of your next turn instead of the end of your turn. Creatures you are hidden towards can still have you Pointed Out by their allies and they can still attempt to Seek for you to find you.

Unseen Allies.name: Unseen Allies
Unseen Allies.description: You lead your group with such skill, no one will ever know any of you were there. When @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.IE2nThCmoyhQA0Jn]{Avoiding Notice} using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.pekKtubQTkG9m1xK]{Quiet Allies}, you can use your modifier instead of the lowest of the group to roll a single Stealth check.

Untangle Ally.name: Untangle Ally
Untangle Ally.description: You know how to pry others from dire straits and tangled messes. You can use @Check[thievery] to attempt to counteract an effect that has an adjacent ally @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.kWc1fhmv9LBiTuei]{Grabbed}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.eIcWbB5o3pP6OIMe]{Immobilized}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.VcDeM8A5oI6VqhbM]{Restrained}. Your counteract level for this check is equal to your level.

Vault.name: Vault
Vault.description:
You are able to vault over small obstacles with little effort. You Stride up to your Speed. During this movement, you can try to move through a single 5-foot cube of difficult terrain or that has an obstacle you could vault over the top (such as a short wall, a trench, a table or a piece of furniture). Attempt an @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:20|showDC:all|options:action:vault:1] check to ignore the difficult terrain or obstacles in the area.

If you are an expert in Acrobatics, you can choose to increase the DC to @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:25|showDC:all|options:action:vault:2]{ } to ignore two 5-foot cubes, and if you are a master in Acrobatics, you can increase the DC to @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:30|showDC:all|options:action:vault:4]{ } to ignore four 5-foot cubes. If you are legendary in Acrobatics, you can increase the DC to @Check[type:acrobatics|dc:40|showDC:all|options:action:vault:8]{ } to ignore eight 5-foot cubes. These cubes must be adjacent to each other, but they can be arranged in any direction.

Success You continue your movement through the area as if the difficult terrain or object were not present.

Critical Failure You fall prone.

Soecial If you have the panache class feature, this action gains the bravado trait.

Vehicle Theft.name: Vehicle Theft
Vehicle Theft.description: When in the business of stealing vehicles, you learn on the job how to make a quick getaway with the score itself. You can use @Check[thievery] in place of Driving Lore or Piloting Lore for piloting checks when piloting vehicles and if you attempt to Disable a vehicle, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check.

Venomous Visionary.name: Venomous Visionary
Venomous Visionary.description: You can easily determine whether creatures or fauna possess poisonous or venomous characteristics. Choose a creature or object within 30 feet you can perceive. You attempt a Survival check against the target's @Check[survival|against:deception]{Deception DC} or @Check[survival|against:stealth]{Stealth DC} if you targeted a creature, or the DC of the poison if you targeted an object. If you succeed, you gain the effects of detect poison against the target. If you are legendary in Survival, you gain the effects of a 2nd-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.QqxwHeYEVylkYjsO]. Regardless of the result, you cannot use Venomous Visionary on the target for 1 day.

Veterinary Training.description: While not all doctors may be experienced in the treatment of beasts and animals, you have a way with such creatures, tending their wounds with care and ensuring their wellbeing. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} on an animal companion or a familiar and you roll a success, you get a critical success instead. In addition, if you successfully use Treat Wounds on an animal that is Indifferent or worse towards you, their attitude towards you improves by one step. A creature cannot improve its attitude towards you in this way more than once per week.
Veterinary Training.name: Veterinary Training

Walking Affliction.name: Walking Affliction
Walking Affliction.description:
You have taken in so many doses of certain poisons or diseases, you become permanently safe from them while easily inflicting them upon others. If you successfully use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.player-options.Item.BKGj5UPAz1amIZxk]{Affliction Mithridatism} on a singular poison or disease for 7 consecutive days (with a critical success counting as two days), you become permanently immune to the disease or poison. You can only ever be immune to a single poison or disease at a time. If you become immune to another poison or disease from this ability, you lose your immunity to the previous affliction.

Once you become immune to an affliction, once per day, you can Interact to coat your unarmed attack, a melee weapon, or ranged weapon with the poison or disease you chose. The next time you successfully Strike with the weapon, the target creature is exposed to the poison or disease. If your Strike was a critical success, the target takes a -2 circumstance penalty to their save against the affliction. You retain the coating until you make a successful Strike or you critically fail a Strike with the unarmed attack or weapon that had your coating.

Alternatively, you can Interact to spike food or drinks, causing the target to be afflicted when they consume the spiked food or drink.

Wallbreaker.name: Wallbreaker
Wallbreaker.description: Walls are simply piles of stones; it is a simple feat to walk through them. You can Stride through a wall of item hardness equal to your level no thicker than 5 feet, treating the wall as greater difficult terrain. When you do so, you leave a hole behind you in your general size. Similarly to a Stride, you can Ignore Walls when you Burrow, Climb, Fly, or Swim if you have the corresponding movement type.

Ward the Sanctified.name: Ward the Sanctified
Ward the Sanctified.description:
You know that carrying deific symbols and sanctified tokens is enough to give you protection from opposing forces. You can spend 1 minute arranging and imbuing trinkets on a creature, to protect them from their ire of creatures with the opposing trait and making a secret Religion check. You can only have Ward the Sanctified on one creature at a time, and using Ward the Sanctified again immediately ends any previous effects. When the target ally encounters a creature with the opposing trait for the first time, the GM compares the result of your @Check[religion|against:will] check against the Will DC of the creature. Regardless of the result, the creature is temporarily immune to the effects of Ward the Sanctified for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.0hxCpVL3UANl2dKX]{Effect: Ward the Sanctified}

Critical Success The creature takes a -2 status penalty to attack rolls against the warded creature until the end of its next turn.

Success As a critical success, but the status penalty is -1.

Critical Failure You made a mistake, and invigorate the creature's wrath against the warded. The creature gains a +2 status bonus to damage against the warded creature.

prerequisites.value: trained in a Lore related to a terrain type

Weather Acclimation.name: Weather Acclimation
Weather Acclimation.description:
Requirements You are in the terrain associated with your related Lore.

You are not as affected by weather changes of a terrain you are familiar with. You are always considered dressed for the weather while in your terrain. When you attempt a save against weather conditions or against natural hazards, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your save. When you become a master in the required Lore, you also ignore circumstance penalties to skill checks from weather or natural hazards while in your terrain.

Xenoglossy.name: Xenoglossy
Xenoglossy.description:
Whether through the influence of the paranormal, the unexplained workings of the brain, or by experiencing a glimpse of your past life, you obtain the ability to speak a language you didn't previously know through inexplicable means. By spending 1 minute, you open your mind to the occult and attempt an Occultism check against a @Check[occultism|dc:20|showDC:none|immutable:true]{DC 20}. If you are a master in Occultism, you can instead do this as a 3-action activity at a @Check[occultism|dc:30|showDC:none|immutable:true]{DC 30}, and if you are legendary in Occultism, as a single action at a @Check[occultism|dc:40|showDC:none|immutable:true]{DC 40}.

Critical Success You gain the ability to speak one language you do not already know of your choice for 5 minutes and you forget it afterwards.

Success As critical success, but the duration is only 1 minute.

Critical Failure Your mind strains at your attempts to purposely invoke this phenomenon and you are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 2} for 1 round and you cannot attempt to use Xenoglossy again for 1 day.

Advancing Avalanche.name: Advancing Avalanche
Advancing Avalanche.description:
Requirements You are adjacent to your partner.

You move together like an impregnable onslaught of snow drowning all. When one of you makes a Strike, the other mayuse their reaction to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the Strike, even if they have not spent a preparatory action to Aid this turn. In addition, when you or your partner makes a Step, you can use a free action to Step to remain adjacent to your partner.

Affliction Clairvoyance.name: Affliction Clairvoyance
Affliction Clairvoyance.description: You call upon the advice of nearby spirits and use your paranormal insight to determine the cause of illness or injury. You may use Occultism in place of Medicine when attempting to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on a disease, poison, or other effects that interfere with healing. If you critically succeed, your clairvoyance rings especially true, granting you a +1 circumstance bonus to your next attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TC7OcDa7JlWbqMaN]{Treat Disease} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.KjoCEEmPGTeFE4hh]{Poison} and to counteract checks against effects that would inhibit healing.

Ancient Magic Academia.name: Ancient Magic Academia
Ancient Magic Academia.description: As a purveyor of the ancient and arcane, you have spent countless hours researching long-dead magical societies and their spellcasting legacies. When you use Arcana to Recall Knowledge or Identify Magic on uncommon or rare spells or magic items, you do not roll against a higher DC due to its rarity. Additionally, you can use Arcana to Recall Knowledge on the cultures and histories of ancient magical societies like Shory, Thassilon, or Jitska instead of Society.

Animal Mimicry.name: Animal Mimicry
Animal Mimicry.description:
Requirements You are undetected to at least one animal or beast within 30 feet.

By mimicking animal calls and noises, you frighten and misdirect animals and beasts who are unable to locate the source of your noises. Attempt a single @Check[type:nature|defense:will] check and compare it against the Will DC of all animals or beasts within 30 feet that you are undetected to. If there are different types of animals or beasts within range, you take a penalty for each different type of animal or beast that is within range. Regardless of the result, creatures are temporarily immune for 24 hours.

Critical Success The creatures become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened 2} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.sDPxOjQ9kx2RZE8D]{Fleeing}. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.iU0fEDdBp3rXpTMC]{Hidden} to the creature until the beginning of your next turn.

Success As critical success, except the creature becomes frightened 1 and is not fleeing.

Failure You are no longer undetected to the creature and you become hidden or observed by the creature if it could observe you.

Antidote Expertise.name: Antidote Expertise
Antidote Expertise.description:
You prepare for the potential exposure to a toxin, venom, or similar such dangers. If you have access to a poison or the body of a creature that produces a poison, you can always produce a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.ktjFOp3U0wQD9t0Z]{lesser antidote} that works specifically against that poison by spending 10 minutes and making a @Check[type:medicine] check against the Craft DC for a lesser antidote by taking time to extract and process the toxin.

When you become a master in Medicine, you can produce a @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.equipment-srd.Item.AJ1dC7EtTIfBey0M]{moderate antidote} instead that covers the entire creature family of the creature you extracted the poison from.

Antimagic Authority.name: Antimagic Authority
Antimagic Authority.description: Your experience with magic as a form of a study and understanding allows you to likewise remove magical effects where you deem necessary. You spend 8 hours using your knowledge of arcane magic to dispel a single spell effect or magical item of your choice, allowing you to produce the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9HpwDN4MYQJnW0LG]{Dispel Magic}. When you attempt to counteract a magical effect in this way, use Arcana for your counteract check and half your level rounded up for the counteract rank. Any item or magical effect above your level causes the counteract check to automatically fail. If you successfully counteract a magic item, you can turn it into a mundane item for 8 hours instead of 10 minutes. Alternatively, you can choose to perform Antimagic Authority by spending 1 hour and increasing the DC to counteract by 2. You must still abide by all other limitations of Antimagic Authority if you cast it in this way. Regardless of the result, targets of Antimagic Authority are temporarily immune for 1 day.

Apprentice Binder.name: Apprentice Binder
Apprentice Binder.description:
Magic has built you a strong connection to denizens nearby. You have learned how to call forth servitors related to your teachings. Choose a spell that corresponds to the prerequisite skill below. You may cast this spell as a 2nd-rank innate spell once per day of a tradition that corresponds with that skill. If you are legendary in the prerequisite skill, the spell is heightened to 4th-rank spell. If the creature you summon is banished from being reduced to 0 Hit Points, you cannot use Apprentice Binder again for 1 week.

Arcana @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4YnON9JHYqtLzccu], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.lKcsmeOrgHtK4xQa], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]

Nature @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hs7h8f4Z1ZNdUt3s], @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.4YnON9JHYqtLzccu], or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.jSRAyd57kd4WZ4yE]

Occultism @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.hs7h8f4Z1ZNdUt3s] or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]

Religion @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.B0FZLkoHsiRgw7gv]servitor} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.9WGeBwIIbbUuWKq0]

prerequisites.value: master in Arcana, Nature, Occultism, or Religion

Become the Mask.name: Become the Mask
Become the Mask.description:
If you take enough time to prepare, almost no one can tell you are acting. You can spend 1 day putting together a performance that emulates the identity of a specific creature and making a @Check[performance] check against a standard DC of the creature's level.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.xSdboiTL7SpeZkec]{Effect: Become the Mask}

Critical Success You gain a +3 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.AJstokjdG6iDjVjE]{Impersonate} when it comes to acting like your persona and on checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ewwCglB7XOPLUz72]{Lie} if they are part of emulating your persona. If you take an action that the creature you are emulating that would be out of character for that creature, this effect ends.

Success As critical success, except the bonus is +2.

Blissful Ignorance.name: Blissful Ignorance
Blissful Ignorance.description: Sometimes, ignorance is bliss. When you're @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied}, you do not take a penalty to Will saves if the effect has the linguistic trait and the flat check for attempting to Cast a Spell while stupefied is @Check[flat|dc:5|showDC:none]{DC 5}, rather than DC 5 + your stupefied value.

Breathing Down The Neck.name: Breathing Down The Neck
Breathing Down The Neck.description: You inspire fear in your enemies when you have them in your clutches. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Demoralize checks against creatures you have grabbed. You do not take a penalty for not sharing a language to Demoralize if you have a creature grabbed.

Conquer Stage Fright.name: Conquer Stage Fright
Conquer Stage Fright.description:
Requirements You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL].

You are all too familiar with the feeling of butterflies fluttering in your stomach. You attempt a Performance check against the DC of the effect that gave you the frightened condition or a standard DC of the effect's level. If you succeed, you reduce the value of your frightened condition by 1, or by 2 if you critically succeeded.

Deep Meditation.name: Deep Meditation
Deep Meditation.description:
Frequency once per hour

You gain the exploration activity Deep Meditation. You can spend 10 minutes meditating to attempt an @Check[occultism|dc:@self.level] or @Check[religion|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.0YUXRpBlb0RGHe0x]{Effect: Deep Meditation}

Critical Success You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the next saving throw against a mental effect within the next hour. If the saving throw also has the emotion trait, the circumstance bonus increases to +2.

SuccessYou gain a +1 circumstance bonus to the next saving throw against an emotion effect within the next hour.

Critical Failure Your meditation is interrupted and you are perturbed. You take a –1 circumstance penalty to your next saving throw within the next hour.

Defensive Flight Maneuver.name: Defensive Flight Maneuver
Defensive Flight Maneuver.description:
Trigger You successfully used Maneuver in Flight.

Flight comes second nature to you and you use it to defend yourself. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the beginning of your next turn. If you are already benefiting from a circumstance bonus to AC from Defensive Flight Maneuver, you instead increase the circumstance bonus to AC from Defensive Flight Maneuver by 1.

prerequisites.value: ability to Fly or gain an effect that allows you to Fly

Delver's Intuition.name: Delver's Intuition
Delver's Intuition.description:
Your knowledge of the structural layout of dungeons and interior environments grants you the skill to map out a room before you've even entered it or find hidden passageways, discovering areas yet unexplored. While exploring a dungeon, you may attempt a @Check[Cartography Lore] check against a DC appropriate for the area (subject to GM discretion), learning the contents of nearby passages, rooms, or walls within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:60]. You cannot use Delver's Intuition on the same area more than once unless you have new information that would allow you to do so.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.XY20I7fkFtLoeYQY]{Effect: Delver's Intuition}

Critical Success You learn the exact dimensions of the area and you automatically learn if there are any secret areas nearby, though you do not learn their exact location or how to enter them. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EwgTZBWsc8qKaViP]{Investigate} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.TiNDYUGlMmxzxBYU]{Search} exploration activities within this area.

Success As critical success, except the circumstance bonus is +1.

Diabolic Precaution.name: Diabolic Precaution
Diabolic Precaution.description: Fiends are far from trustworthy, and devils especially. You've studied their tricks, and when you listen to their words, you know not to ignore any double-meanings. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against mental effects from devils and you can roll Religion to [[/act sense-motive skill=religion]] against devils. You can use your Religion DC instead of your Perception DC when devils attempt to deceive you and for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.d9gbpiQjChYDYA2L]{Decipher Writing} when reading diabolic documents (such as contracts).

Diplomat's Caution.name: Diplomat's Caution
Diplomat's Caution.description: You are careful with your words and mindful of how to use them, particularly when you speak to those who dislike you. When you attempt to Make an Impression on a creature whose attitude towards you or your allies is Indifferent or worse, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your check. If you are a master in Diplomacy, you increase the circumstance bonus to +2.

Divine Arsenal.name: Divine Arsenal
Divine Arsenal.description:
You are versed in the weapon your deity favors. You gain access to your deity's favored weapon, and for the purpose of proficiency, you treat it as a simple weapon if it was a martial weapon, or a martial weapon if it was an advanced weapon.

In addition, you become bound by your deities edicts and anathema, and if you ever fail to follow your deity's edicts or commit an anathema for your deity, you are cursed by your deity and lose the benefits of this feat until you complete an atone ritual.

prerequisites.value: You worship a deity with a martial or advanced favored weapon

Doom Walker.name: Doom Walker
Doom Walker.description:
No one walks the thin line between being alive or dead more finely than you. You might have crossed some soul-consuming monster that drained your soul, or perhaps cheated death as a reaction three too many times within 10 minutes. You look pallid like a corpse and might even be mistaken as a revenant, with the exception that you are very certain you have never died… yet.

During your daily preparations, you can spend some time aligning your energy to the living or the dead. If you align yourself to the living, you benefit from effects with the healing trait and are harmed by void damage as a living creature would; if you have the void healing ability, you lose it. If you align yourself with the dead, you gain void healing, taking damage from vitality damage and healing from void damage. You gain a +1 status bonus against effects that would give you the doomed condition or increase your doomed condition value. These effects last until your next daily preparations.

At 13th level, the status bonus increases to +2. In addition, when you align yourself with the living, you also become able to understand and speak Empyrean. If you align yourself with the dead, you are able to understand and speak Necril instead.

Drop Out of Sight.name: Drop Out of Sight
Drop Out of Sight.description: You stay low to the ground to avoid detection. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HYNhdaPtF1QmQbR3]{Drop Prone}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ust1jJSCZQUhBZIz]{Take Cover}, and then @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide}.

Duck and Weave.name: Duck and Weave
Duck and Weave.description:
Requirements You are unarmored or wearing light armor.

You step quickly, dodge and dance around attacks rather than let them actually touch you. Choose one creature with 30 feet. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your AC against all of the creature's attacks until the beginning of your next turn. You cannot make Strikes or take hostile actions against creatures other than the target of your Duck and Weave until the beginning of your next turn and you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.FwXfIfjV8i9vbOdN]{Twist from Harm} reaction while your Duck and Weave remains in effect.

Echo Listener.name: Echo Listener
Echo Listener.description:
Requirements You are underground or in a location that could produce an echo.

You can use a rock or stone to ascertain distances. When in the required area, when you Interact to throw a small stone or other similar object and make a Mining Lore check against a DC determined by the GM to listen for an echo (usually at least a DC 30). If you are successful, you automatically detect any creatures within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] of where the object landed, or a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30] if your result was a critical success.

Echoing Earth.description: By concentrating and focusing on the ground beneath your feet, you temporarily obtain a heightened sensitivity to vibrations in the earth. You gain tremorsense as an imprecise sense with a range of 10 feet until the end of your next turn as you feel sensations in the earth. If you are legendary in Nature, increase the range of the tremorsense to 20 feet.
Echoing Earth.name: Echoing Earth

Effective Triage.name: Effective Triage
Effective Triage.description: You are skilled at bringing a creature back from the edge of death. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.MHLuKy4nQO2Z4Am1]{Administer First Aid} to stabilize a creature, on a success, the target gains [[/r @actor.level]] Hit Points at the beginning of its next turn and regains consciousness.

Elemental Enlightenment.name: Elemental Enlightenment
Elemental Enlightenment.description: Whether a denizen of the elemental planes or merely an erudite scholar of their elemental magic, you have a particular area of expertise over the elements. You gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Arcana or Nature checks to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.eReSHVEPCsdkSL4G]{Identify Magic} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} against creatures, items, or spells with the air, earth, fire, metal, water, or wood traits.

Ephemeral Echoes.name: Ephemeral Echoes
Ephemeral Echoes.description:
Requirements You are hidden or undetected to at least one creature.

You use trickery, magic, or some other method to leave behind ghostly echoes of your presence. You [[/act create-a-diversion skill=stealth]] and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.VMozDqMMuK5kpoX4]{Sneak}, where creatures you are hidden to nearby hear the tell-tale signs of a sneak revealed, like a pebble accidentally kicked about, the shuffling of clothes, or even an overconfident chuckle. When done this way, you roll Stealth instead of Deception for your Create a Diversion and it gains only the auditory trait with the following results instead of the normal results of Create a Diversion.

Success Creatures whose Perception DC is less than or equal to your result from Create a Diversion treats you as concealed until the beginning of your next turn or you would become observed.

Failure Creatures whose Perception DC exceeds your result from Create a Diversion instead gain a +2 circumstance bonus to their Perception DC against your Sneak from Ephemeral Echoes.

Expanded Hunt.name: Expanded Hunt
Expanded Hunt.description: You've added more types of monsters to your portfolio. You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.player-options.Item.GKZXQJrFvfuou6Hb]{Know the Quarry} and @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.player-options.Item.DY886d80tKN8D7Cn]{Take What's Needed} on dragons, fungi, and plants in addition to animals and beasts. You might be able to select other creature types you frequently encounter while using your Hunting Lore, such as constructs or undead, subject to GM discretion.

prerequisites.value: Know the Quarry or Take What's Needed

Fortunate One.name: Fortunate One
Fortunate One.description:
When misfortune befalls you, you know that luck is soon to follow. When you are subject to a non-trivial misfortune effect, you gain a +1 status bonus to the next check you make for 1 hour after you were subject to the misfortune effect.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.zjgmJUE2bBzHExlS]{Effect: Fortunate One}

Freefall.name: Freefall
Freefall.description:
Trigger Your turn begins.

You understand the tactical importance of taking cover on the ground. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HYNhdaPtF1QmQbR3]{Drop Prone}.

Gaze Into the Tapestry.name: Gaze Into the Tapestry
Gaze Into the Tapestry.description: The images burned into your eyes will never leave you, carving an eternal doom into your very soul. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.xFp4EwVcYwSG336t] as an occult innate spell once per day and the spell is heightened to a rank equal to half your level rounded up. When you gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} condition, make a @Check[flat|dc:2]. On a failure, your dread cracks open a rift into the dread dimensions. You produce the effects of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.i1TvBID5QLyXrUCa] with a rank equal to half your level rounded up, except the creature is hostile towards you and your allies and the effect does not need to be sustained.The creature appears within 30 feet of you, typically in the safest and closest location to you it is able to.

prerequisites.value: You saw into the DarkTapestry, or beheld the true appearance of a powerful denizen of the Tapestry

Geologic Genius.name: Geologic Genius
Geologic Genius.description: You are an experienced connoisseur of geology, from beautiful gems, to natural metals, to simple sediments and can spot things that are out of place in cavernous environments. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Recall Knowledge on all creatures, gems, or items with the earth or metal traits and to Perception checks to notice hazards in natural formations of earth, rock, or stone. Additionally, you can use Nature to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} by searching for valuable deposits of minerals and gems, provided you are in a location that could reasonably contain such materials (subject to GM discretion).

Harden Heart.name: Harden Heart
Harden Heart.description: You have learned to stifle the presence of adrenaline through continued exposure to danger, allowing you to steel yourself against emotional turbulence. If you are subjected to an emotion effect before the beginning of your next turn, the creature that produced the effect must succeed at an additional check against your Survival DC to affect you with the effect. If the effect would require a save instead of a check, such as the fear spell, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your save. This circumstance bonus increases to +3 if you are legendary in Survival.

Heightened Spell.name: Heightened Spell
Heightened Spell.description:
Frequency once per hour

You empower a spell calling on a reservoir of conserved power. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell that is at least 3 ranks lower than the highest-rank spell slot you have, you treat the rank of the spell as 2 higher for the purposes of numerical effects based on its heightened rank, such as damage, healing, increased area, bonuses, or penalties. You do not gain any other effects associated with the heightened rank, such as being able to target more creatures or treating the spell as a higher level for the purposes of counteracting or the incapacitation trait.

Improvised Self-Medication.name: Improvised Self-Medication
Improvised Self-Medication.description: You have learned how to treat your own wounds and bleeding without tools. You can use Survival to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} and to [[/act administer-first-aid skill=survival]] instead of Medicine when you target yourself, including higher Survival proficiency letting you attempt more difficult checks. It doesn't replace Medicine for uses of the skill other than these activities or for feat prerequisites. In addition, you can use these activities even if you are not wielding or holding healer's tools but you take a -2 circumstance penalty to your check if you do. If you are a master in Survival, you no longer take a circumstance penalty for not having healer's tools.

Improvising Healer.name: Improvising Healer
Improvising Healer.description:
You always stuff makeshift healing items into your tool bags and pouches for when you don't have a healer's kit handy or when you have run out of supplies. You can attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1kGNdIIhuglAjIp9]{Treat Wounds} without healer's tools.

Special If you have @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.wYerMk6F1RZb0Fwt]{Battle Medicine}, you can use Battle Medicine even if you are not wearing or holding healer's tools

In Wolf's Clothing.name: In Wolf's Clothing
In Wolf's Clothing.description: You know the lingo and mannerisms of those who work in criminal organizations. You can choose to present yourself as a member of a criminal organization and individuals do not generally question it. You can use Underworld Lore to [[/act lie skill=underworld-lore]]{Lie (Underworld Lore)} to pretend to be a criminal, as well as with [[/act impersonate skill=underworld-lore]]{Impersonate (Underworld Lore)} to pretend to be a member of a specific criminal organization. If you use the normal skills in those situations, you receive a +1 circumstance bonus to the check instead.

Kaiju Blood.name: Kaiju Blood
Kaiju Blood.description: The awesome power of a kaiju has scrambled you on a subatomic level, and while you remain unchanged for the most part, a trace of its power remains within you. When you become agitated, your blood glows with the power of the kaiju, and you are given unmatched strength. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.Ig8amOmlbl6VkzzK]{Unleash Kaiju Strength} ability.

Knock Sprawling.name: Knock Sprawling
Knock Sprawling.description: When you make someone fall, you propel them so that they hit the floor hard. When you roll a critical success to Trip you can choose to push your target 10 feet away instead of dealing 1d6 bludgeoning damage. If the target of your Trip makes contact with a wall or hard object, they take an additional @Damage[1d6[bludgeoning]] damage. This is forced movement.

Lessons from the Parables.name: Lessons from the Parables
Lessons from the Parables.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You fail a skill check using the divine skill of the deity whose Lore you are master in.

Knowledge of the deity's teachings, practices, and sacred texts allows you to save yourself from occasional peril by uttering a quick prayer in succession. Reroll the triggering check using your deity's Lore, but you must use the new result, even if it's worse than your first roll.

prerequisites.value: master in a Lore related to a deity

Ligneous Skin.description: The line between flesh and flora blurs where the Plane of Wood's vitality healed your most grievous injuries, and now part of you is plant-like, resembling bark. You gain the wood trait, and the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.AmP0qu7c5dlBSath]{Toughness} general feat. You can cast @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.YWrfKetOqDwVFut7] once per day as a primal innate spell, but you can only target yourself.
Ligneous Skin.name: Ligneous Skin

Liturgical Performance.name: Liturgical Performance
Liturgical Performance.description:
You know how to sing hymns, perform ritual dances or share divine jokes from your study of faiths. You can roll a Religion check instead of a Performance check when using the Perform action, and your Perform takes a -1 circumstance penalty if the audience opposes your faith and gains a +1 circumstance bonus if the audience favors your faith, as determined by the GM.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.7h1fcYfzPmAnQw1o]{Effect: Liturgical Performance}

Magical Notation.name: Magical Notation
Magical Notation.description: You can transcribe spells as if they are music. You can Craft scrolls of the spells you know in the tradition of the magic you cast as if you have the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.xWY5omyIcILNR7y1]{Magical Crafting} skill feat so long as the spell you choose to imbue into the scroll has the auditory or visual trait. When you make these scrolls, you can use Performance to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.rmwa3OyhTZ2i2AHl]{Craft} instead of Crafting and you use your Performance to determine what items you can Craft. You still need to provide any material components and costs necessary as usual.

Masked by the Masses.name: Masked by the Masses
Masked by the Masses.description: You can intermingle with the people of the busy streets well to hide your presence. You ignore difficult terrain from crowds, and treat greater difficult terrain from them as difficult terrain. Additionally, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.XMcnh4cSI32tljXa]{Hide} when in a crowd.

Master Anthropologist.name: Master Anthropologist
Master Anthropologist.description:
You have studied cultures, societies, linguistics and the like long enough that you can draw conclusions from commonalities and differences. Roll a Society check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on up to 5 different items, locations, or creatures that would normally require you to use Society to identify. When Recalling Knowledge this way, the DC is decreased by 1 for each item, location, or creature you included in your Recall Knowledge, however, questions you ask must apply to all 5 of the subjects you chose.

For example, you might ask if all the creatures have a specific ability or if all the locations are known hangouts of a local crime guild. On a success, the GM answers "yes" if the question is true for all targets, "mostly" if the question is true for at least more than half of the targets, and "no" otherwise. If a feat or effect would grant you additional facts on a successful Recall Knowledge, the additional facts also follow the same requirements for commonalities.

May They Abandon You!.name: May They Abandon You!
May They Abandon You!.description:
Frequency once per hour

Trigger A creature within 30 feet that you can observe makes an attack roll using the deity's favored weapon or a skill check using the divine skill of the deity whose Lore you are trained in.

You know religious phrases which might withdraw a deity's blessing upon a person or bring some form of tiny punishment. The creature must attempt a Will save against your Lore DC. Regardless of the result, the target becomes immune to this effect for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.Acjac0F0AF4qRTqE]{Effect: May They Abandon You!}

Critical Success You bolster the target's faith. They gain a +1 status bonus to the triggering check.

Success The target is unaffected.

Failure The creature takes a –1 status penalty to the triggering roll.

Critical Failure The creature takes a –2 status penalty to the triggering roll.

prerequisites.value: trained in a Lore related to a deity

Meditatory Defenses.name: Meditatory Defenses
Meditatory Defenses.description: You have learned to use meditation to prevent your mind from succumbing to mental effects. During your daily preparations, you can meditate to steel your mind against the mental burdens of the day and your GM makes a secret @Check[survival] check on your behalf. Once per day, when you attempt a save against mental effect, you can choose to use the result of your secret Survival check for your save against the effect instead of the normal defense. Alternatively, if you use the normal defense, you receive a +2 circumstance bonus to your check instead.

Mirror Meeting.name: Mirror Meeting
Mirror Meeting.description: By writing on foggy glass or inscribing a person's name in blood upon a mirror, you form a connection between two reflective surfaces to use for communicative purposes. By spending 10 minutes you infuse a single mirror or similar solid reflective surface of up to 5 bulk as a mirror you can use to communicate with later. If you perform this exploration activity again on another mirror meeting the same requirements, you successfully forge a connection between the two surfaces. You can only have two mirrors connected like this at a time, and when you forge a new connection, you choose which of the two previous mirrors to become inert. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.qKug2AYUe8NvVUr5]{Mirror Mirror} activity.

Monochrome Mystique.name: Monochrome Mystique
Monochrome Mystique.description:
You know how to best use colors and shadows to decorate yourself in such a way that makes you stick out like a sore thumb–except in the dark, where the shadows fail to give outlines and the colors meld together into an amorphous sea of gray. You can spend 1 minute to rearrange your clothing in such a way you still become concealed in dim light or darkness to creatures who have darkvision (but not greater darkvision), but doing so makes you more easily found in bright light giving creatures a +2 circumstance bonus to their Perception DCs against your Stealth checks. You can take this activity again to return your clothes to their normal status, losing the benefits but also the drawback.

Kayals and similar creatures whose darkvision allows them to see in full color even in the dark treat you as if you were within light even in darkness and dim light.

Monumental Shove.name: Monumental Shove
Monumental Shove.description: When you knock someone around, you really throw them. Shove a target within your reach. If your Shove is successful, the creature moves an additional number of feet equal to the result of your check divided by 2 and rounded up to the nearest 5-foot increment. If your Shove is a critical success and the target collides with an object, the target takes bludgeoning damage equal to the distance of your Shove.

Moonscarred.name: Moonscarred

prerequisites.value: You were cured of the curse of the were-creatures

Moonscarred.description:
Though you were spared of the existence of a were-creature, something primal still runs wild in you when the moon rises. When the sun sets and until the sun rises, you gain an imprecise sense of smell with a range of 30 feet, temporary Hit Points equal to your level, and you can ask questions of, receive answers from, and use the Diplomacy skill with animals associated with your cured curse (such as canines if you were a werewolf). In most cases, wild animals will give you time to make your case.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.PFgq0FHmrZn6z4bW]{Effect: Moonscarred}

Mystic Metacarpus.name: Mystic Metacarpus
Mystic Metacarpus.description: Many beginner arcanists and wizards learn a few basic cantrips when embarking on their journey to learn arcane magic, and conjuring a magical hand is but one of many. You can cast 1st-rank @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.pwzdSlJgYqN7bs2w]{Telekinetic Hand} at will as an arcane innate spell. If you're a master in Arcana, the spell is heightened to 3rd rank. If you're legendary in Arcana, the spell is heightened to 5th rank.

Necromancer's Knowledge.name: Necromancer's Knowledge
Necromancer's Knowledge.description: Despite undead creatures and the Void being the purview of the divine rather than arcane, your knowledge of such forces goes beyond mere tradition in the pursuit of, or against, the machinations of the undead. You learn Necril or another language if you already know Necril. When you attempt to Recall Knowledge against undead, you can roll Arcana instead of Religion. If you are a master in Arcana, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to Recall Knowledge checks against undead.

No Cause for Alarm+.name: No Cause for Alarm+
No Cause for Alarm+.description:
You attempt to reduce panic. Attempt a @Check[diplomacy] check, comparing it to the Will DC of creatures in a @Template[emanation|distance:10] around you who are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened}. Each of them is temporarily immune for 1 hour. If you are a master in Diplomacy, the emanation increases to a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15], and if you are legendary in Diplomacy, increase the emanation to a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20].

Critical Success Reduce the creature's frightened value by 2.

Success Reduce the creature's frightened value by 1.

On Borrowed Time.name: On Borrowed Time
On Borrowed Time.description:
Frequency once per day

Trigger You would gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.yZRUzMqrMmfLu0V1]{Dying} condition but not die outright during an encounter.

You feel the grasp of death closing in on you, but you have a task you must still yet do. You do not gain the dying condition and remain at 1 Hit Point by giving yourself a task that you could reasonably complete within 1 minute, but the task must be non-trivial and include at least one attack roll or skill check (subject to GM discretion). You gain 60 temporary Hit Points that last for 1 minute. If you complete the task you gave yourself before the minute is up or before you lose all of the temporary Hit Points you received from this action, you restore a number of Hit Points equal to half the remaining temporary Hit Points from this effect.

Opening Accompaniment.name: Opening Accompaniment
Opening Accompaniment.description:
Trigger You would roll initiative in an encounter.

You perform to bolster your allies motivation. Choose one ally within 30 feet and make a Performance check against a standard DC of their level. Regardless of the outcome of your roll, the ally becomes immune to this action for 1 day.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.AJsTRf9iHyrZzM5H]{Effect: Opening Accompaniment}

Critical Success Your ally gains a +2 status bonus to their initiative. If they tie with an enemy, they always go first.

Success As critical success, but the status bonus is +1.

Critical Failure You fumble your own start. You take a -4 penalty to your initiative.

Pantomime Need.name: Pantomime Need
Pantomime Need.description: While you cannot convey what you wish verbally when you do not share a language with the creature you are communicating with, you know how to use gestures, movements, and a good dash of physical comedy to communicate what you want. You can make a [[/act request skill=performance]] using your Performance instead of Diplomacy by pantomiming and your Request loses its auditory and linguistic traits and gains the visual trait. When you make a Request in this way, you receive a -2 circumstance penalty to your Request. If you are a master in Performance, you no longer take this circumstance penalty to your Request, and if you are legendary in Performance you can use Pantomime Need as a single action instead of a 2-action activity.

Pendulum Tactics.name: Pendulum Tactics
Pendulum Tactics.description:
Requirements You or your partner has the chosen creature within your melee reach.

You and your allies have developed a unique variation of hit-and-run tactics. When you employ this teamwork, choose a single creature within yours or your partner's reach. Whenever you or your partner successfully Strike a foe with a melee attack that both of you have within your melee reach, the other may Step as a free action.

Persistent Spell.name: Persistent Spell
Persistent Spell.description:
Frequency once per hour

You leave a lingering, festering, residue of magic on your foes after you inflict damage upon them. If your next action is to Cast a Spell that targets a single creature and deals damage, that creature takes additional persistent damage equal to twice the spell's rank, matching the damage type of the spell if they fail their saving throw, or your attack roll is a success. If they critically fail their save or you critically succeed on the attack roll, the persistent damage is doubled. If a spell would deal more than one type of damage, you must choose one of the damage types for this persistent damage.

Phantasm's Phase-Through.name: Phantasm's Phase-Through
Phantasm's Phase-Through.description: You move like a ghost, nary a thought to creatures in your way as you slip your way through them. You Sneak. You can move through the enemy's spaces you are hidden, undetected, or unnoticed towards during this movement, treating the squares in the enemy's space as difficult terrain (every 5 feet costs 10 feet of movement).

Pick on Someone Your Own Size.name: Pick on Someone Your Own Size
Pick on Someone Your Own Size.description:
When you strike fear in your enemies, they cower and feel smaller in stature. For the purposes of determining whether you can take an action against a creature given its size, a creature you successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.2u915NdUyQan6uKF]{Demoralize} is considered one size smaller than it actually is so long as it remains @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.TBSHQspnbcqxsmjL]{Frightened} from your Demoralize action. You gain a +1 circumstance bonus to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PMbdMWc2QroouFGD]{Grapple}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.lOE4yjUnETTdaf2T]{Reposition}, @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.7blmbDrQFNfdT731]{Shove}, or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ge56Lu1xXVFYUnLP]{Trip} against creatures frightened by your Demoralize if they are larger than you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.d3EHjXgDun0hz7Qo]{Effect: Pick on Someone Your Own Size}

Pinpoint Out.name: Pinpoint Out
Pinpoint Out.description:
Trigger You detect a creature using @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.BlAOM2X92SI6HMtJ]{Seek}.

You have learned how to communicate with indiscriminate detail to allies. You immediately @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.sn2hIy1iIJX9Vpgj]{Point Out} the creature and your allies gain a +2 circumstance to their Perception check if they are unable to see or understand you.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.JOwwEGi101nC1QGd]{Effect: Pinpoint Out}

Prepared for Collapse.name: Prepared for Collapse
Prepared for Collapse.description: You have seen enough collapses to know how to avoid them and are light on your feet when an impending fall would occur. You gain a +1 status bonus against Reflex saves that would result from collapsing structures. In addition, you can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.3yoajuKjwHZ9ApUY]{Grab an Edge} as a free action instead of a reaction.

Primal Intonation.name: Primal Intonation
Primal Intonation.description:
Your voice booms and resounds with the rhythm of nature, inspiring awe and commanding respect in the beasts you encounter. Attempt a @Check[type:nature|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level. If you are not in an area with animals present, you automatically fail this check (subject to GM discretion).

Critical Success You call forth one creature with the animal trait that is at least 6 levels lower than you (minimum -1). This creature is helpful to you and your allies and remains in the area for at least 1 minute before leaving.

Success As critical success, but the creature is friendly to you and your allies.

Critical Failure A creature of the wild answers your call... and it is not happy! An animal appears of a level appropriate for the area and is hostile to you and your allies. The creature may attack you, inhibit your journey, or take other actions against you as long as you remain in the area. If an animal is lower level than you or your allies, it will flee if threatened.

Primary Threat.name: Primary Threat
Primary Threat.description:
Requirements Your turn begins and it is the first round of combat with at least one enemy creature.

When a fight begins, you make it clear you should be the one people are concerned about. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.A72nHGUtNXgY5Ey9]{Delay} while presenting an imposing afront to your enemies. Enemy creatures that go after you used Delay take a –1 circumstance penalty to attack rolls against your allies until the beginning of your next turn. Creatures can remove this penalty by spending a single action with the concentrate trait to do their own threat evaluation.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.BPfWwVa2tSARRdIN]{Effect: Primary Threat}

Professional Tour Guide.name: Professional Tour Guide

prerequisites.value: expert in a Lore related to a settlement or region

Professional Tour Guide.description:
Requirements You are in the location associated with your related Lore.

You can make a living regaling tourists with various facts and stories, with the occasional embellishment. You can always find at least one task equal to your level within the required location when you attempt to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}. If you use the related Lore to Earn Income, you treat the task level as one higher for the purposes of currency earned, two higher if you are a master, or four higher if you are legendary.

In addition, when you successfully Earn Income with the related Lore, you grant any creatures you interacted with during the activity a +1 circumstance bonus to saves against severe cold, heat, or weather, and to saves and checks against hazards normal for the required location for 1 day.

Profitable Business Venture.name: Profitable Business Venture
Profitable Business Venture.description:
You know how to make more money than most when running a business. You can always find at least one task equal or greater than the settlement's level as long as you have been in that settlement for at least 1 day. If you use Mercantile Lore to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income}, you treat the task level as one higher for the purposes of currency earned, two higher if you are a master, or four higher if you are legendary.

In addition, when you successfully Earn Income with Mercantile Lore, you get the effects of a successful @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OX4fy22hQgUHDr0q]{Make an Impression} on any creatures you bartered with during the activity if it was your first time interacting with them with the same degree of success as your check.

Protector of the Wilds.name: Protector of the Wilds
Protector of the Wilds.description: As a defender of the wild and preserver of ecosystems, you have learned to fight nature sans lethality. When making a nonlethal Strike while using a weapon that lacks the nonlethal trait against a creature with the animal, beast, plant, or fungus traits, you do not take the -2 circumstance penalty to the attack roll.

Quick Stored Item.name: Quick Stored Item
Quick Stored Item.description: Your familiarity with stored items allows you to sort through your bag and find the right item you need in a moment of tension. You can spend 1 minute preparing a specific item stored on your person that takes a single action or less to Activate for quick access. You can Interact to draw that item and Activate it as a single action that has the flourish trait. You can only designate one item at a time to be stored in this way at a time.

Rapid Rallying.name: Rapid Rallying
Rapid Rallying.description: You have worked with your party to come up with a faster way to settle their nerves by adding a gesture-a snap, a clap, or thump to the chest-to get their attention and rally their courage. You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.6ON8DjFXSMITZleX]{No Cause For Alarm} as a single action by giving it your choice of the manipulate or visual traits, expanding the emanation to a @Template[type:emanation|distance:20]. If you are legendary in Diplomacy, the emanation increases to a @Template[type:emanation|distance:30].

Re-Rig.name: Re-Rig
Re-Rig.description:
You can reactivate a disabled device with a few favorable adjustments. You can use @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.cYdz2grcOcRt4jk6]{Disable a Device} on a disabled device or trap. If you do, replace the usual results with the following.

Success The device or trap is reset, and you can change its reaction's trigger to exclude you and your allies or to activate in a set time. Your GM might allow you to change the trigger in other ways as well.

Failure The device or trap fails to reset.

Critical Failure The device or trap is reset, and is immediately triggered.

Recall Lessons.name: Recall Lessons
Recall Lessons.description:
Trigger An ally within 30 feet of you attempts to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} while not in an encounter.

You remind your ally of some crucial detail regarding the topic. Make an Academia Lore check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.HCl3pzVefiv9ZKQW]{Aid} the triggering action as if you had spent a preparatory action to Aid. If they roll a critical failure, they get a failure instead.

Readied Striker.name: Readied Striker
Readied Striker.description: You are more vigilant with preparation, allowing you to move more rapidly. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.dLgAMt3TbkmLkUqE]{Ready} to make a Strike, you can do so as a single action instead of a 2-action activity.

Reserving Preparation.name: Reserving Preparation
Reserving Preparation.description: As a result of your familiarity with preparing spells each day, you have discovered additional ways to modify your spells during the adventuring day. During daily preparations, pick one spell you know of a rank 2 lower than the highest rank spell slot you have. You can spend 10 minutes Refocusing to replace one spell you've prepared in one of your class's spell slots with the spell you chose, heightened to the same level. The spell you replaced must be of at least the selected spell's minimum spell level.

prerequisites.value: ability to cast spells from spell slots

Reshaped Spell.name: Reshaped Spell
Reshaped Spell.description: You take the name spellshaping quite literally, reshaping the form of a spell you cast in order to cover a different area. If the next action you use is to Cast a Spell with an area that is a cone or a line, you may alter the area of the spell to a line or a cone respectively. For the purposes of the area the spell covers, a line is always twice the length of a cone, and a cone is always half the length of a line.

Resilient Body.name: Resilient Body
Resilient Body.description: You are capable of staving off damaging effects more easily than others. You treat the DC for flat checks to recover from persistent damage as 2 lower than normal.

Riding Ally.name: Riding Ally
Riding Ally.description: You have learned how to harness the power of intelligent mounts. You can @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.PM5jvValFkbFH3TV]{Mount} your allies and your allies can Mount you. You must still meet any size requirements necessary for the Mount action. During an encounter, when you are riding an ally or when an ally is riding you, you both roll your initiatives and use the lower of the two results for both your initiatives. The rider chooses which of the two of you goes first in initiative. The person riding gains 2 actions instead of 3, as they must use the other action to guide or steady your ally, but the creature being ridden gains 3 actions.

Ripples and Whispers.name: Ripples and Whispers
Ripples and Whispers.description:
You hear things, even when you aren't actively listening. Whenever you successfully @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} using Underworld Lore while within a settlement, you gain the effects of a successful Gather Information with the same tier of success as you rolled for your Earn Income.

In addition, when you are in a settlement you have used Underworld Lore to Earn Income within in the last month, other creatures using Underworld Lore to Earn Income or that are performing criminal activity must succeed at a Deception check against your Underworld Lore DC or you become aware of the criminal activity through word of mouth the following day.

Ritual Glyphs.name: Ritual Glyphs
Ritual Glyphs.description:
Frequency Once per day

You have an advantage when leveraging your knowledge of arcane magic while performing rituals through the creation of specialized glyphs. By spending 10 minutes, you draw additional glyphs and runes in the ritual space as part of its preparation. If you do so, you and all allies participating in the ritual gain a +1 circumstance bonus to all primary and secondary checks or increase the value of their circumstance bonus by 1. These glyphs only last for the duration of a single ritual casting and fade upon its completion. If you are a master in Arcana, the circumstances bonuses applied increase by 2 instead of 1.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.CE6OH0P8jV2WUrok]{Effect: Ritual Glyphs}

Savage Success.description:
Trigger You reduce an enemy to 0 Hit Points with a melee unarmed attack that is not a fist.

Bloodlust fills your thoughts as you enter a state of primal ferocity. Your non-fist melee unarmed Strikes gain a circumstance bonus to damage equal to the number of weapon damage dice. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.0sLZW5D6ziJY7yD0]{Feral Lunge} bold activity.

prerequisites.value: You have a permanent melee unarmed attack other than fist

Savage Success.name: Savage Success

Scribe Teleportation Glyph.name: Scribe Teleportation Glyph
Scribe Teleportation Glyph.description: Through the creation of complex glyphs and mathematical arcane equations, you have developed the ability to cross long distances, provided the glyphs you inscribe are connected to one another. By spending 8 hours, you can scribe a teleportation glyph on a flat surface that is at least 15 feet in size. You can have up to two teleportation glyphs at any given time, and if you create an additional glyph, one of the previous glyphs ceases to function. Additionally, you obtain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.IHsF4m0fgqRzwUZ3]{Activate Glyph} activity.

Second-Hand Sleight.name: Second-Hand Sleight
Second-Hand Sleight.description:
If you're reappropriating items from your victims, you might as well help yourself to some extras. When you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.RDXXE7wMrSPCLv5k]{Steal} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.ijZ0DDFpMkWqaShd]{Palm an Object}, you can do so to up to two objects at once. You roll a single Thievery check, using the lowest modifier that would apply, against the highest DCs that would apply. For example, if you're trying to Steal an item from a pocket (which would apply a -5 penalty to your check), and at the same time, you try to steal a single page out of a stack of documents (which would increase the DC), you apply both the –5 penalty and the increased DC to your single Thievery check, even though you received each from trying to Steal different items.

If you're a master in Thievery, you may Steal or Palm up to 3 objects with one check, and if you're legendary, this increases to up to 4 items.

Second-Nature Cantrip.name: Second-Nature Cantrip
Second-Nature Cantrip.description: A particular cantrip is always within your grasp, even if you don't have it prepared. Choose one cantrip from your spellcasting tradition. When you use the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.OQaFzDtVEOMWizJJ]{Repeat a Spell} exploration activity with the cantrip you chose, you do not need to move at half speed. If you are at least 15th level, you can select another exploration activity to perform while using Repeat a Spell.

Secret Stash.name: Secret Stash
Secret Stash.description: You can hide exceedingly large items on your person through clever use of layers of clothing, magic, or other methods. The maximum size limit for @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.qVNVSmsgpKFGk9hV]{Concealing an Object} on your own person is 1 Bulk. If you're a master in Stealth, the limit increases to 2 Bulk.

Shallows' Sallow Shadows.name: Shallows' Sallow Shadows
Shallows' Sallow Shadows.description:
Those who can't keep track of their line aren't of much use for fishing or on a vessel at sea. If you @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on a creature that has a permanent swim Speed, you also learn about one ability it has that requires a saving throw, if any, and you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to your saves and DCs against that ability for 1 minute.

@UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.bpIFxizPX8b6ys3Z]{Effect: Shallows' Sallow Shadows}

prerequisites.value: trained in Fishing Lore, Ocean Lore, or Sailing Lore

Sight Reading.name: Sight Reading
Sight Reading.description: You know how to read various types of music and translate them, which gives you a boost in understanding magical writing and translating them into spells. You can use Performance to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.Q5iIYCFdqJFM31GW]{Learn a Spell} from scrolls and spellbooks provided the spell has either the auditory or visual trait and you can use Performance to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on spells with these traits. You may also use Performance to Identify Magic on magic items that are associated with performance (subject to GM discretion).

Sing-Along.name: Sing-Along
Sing-Along.description:
You start doing a well-known routine or singing a commonly known song, compelling a creature to join in. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.EEDElIyin4z60PXx]{Perform} and compare your result against the Will DC of a humanoid creature within 30 feet. If the creature does not understand the language you used for your Perform, they get a +4 circumstance bonus to their Will DC. Regardless of the result, the creature is temporarily immune to this effect for 1 day.

Critical Success The creature is @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} and cannot use reactions until they Perform to join in your song, uses a skill action that has either the auditory trait to counter it, or a single action with the concentrate trait to ignore it.

Success As critical success, except the creature is not stupefied.

Critical Failure You are enraptured in your own song, but no one else is listening. You are @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.AJh5ex99aV6VTggg] until the beginning of your next turn.

Skin of my Teeth.name: Skin of my Teeth
Skin of my Teeth.description:
Trigger You used @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.jM72TjJ965jocBV8]{Shield Block} to reduce incoming damage that would have reduced you to 0 Hit Points.

Your spirit is bolstered after a close shave with death. Increase the triggering shield's Hardness by 2. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e-feats-plus.misc.Item.lZdH7vYrwuAuCovT]{Best Defense} action.

Spell Tag.name: Spell Tag
Spell Tag.description:
Frequency once per 10 minutes

You channel the power of your spell through an ally. If your next action is to Cast a Spell with a range of touch, you can instead touch an ally, imbuing them with the spell until the beginning of your next turn and preserving the spell's energy. Your ally can deliver the spell on your behalf to a creature by using Interact to touch it and expending the spell immediately. If your ally's Interact is interrupted or fails to deliver the spell with an Interact before the end of its turn, the spell dissipates with no effect.

prerequisites.value: ability to cast spells from spell slots

Spellshaper Initiate.name: Spellshaper Initiate
Spellshaper Initiate.description: You have picked up some rudimentary knowledge of spellshaping. You gain the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.FoWO4RnHRwfEIC7Q]{Widen Spell} or @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.BWomK7EVY0WXxWgh]{Reach Spell} class feat and that feat is a class feat of your class.

Spellshaping Synergy.name: Spellshaping Synergy
Spellshaping Synergy.description:
Requirements You are employing Shared Spellshaping. You need to meet this requirement only to employ this teamwork, not to remain in it.

You have learned how to help others shape spells by weaving your own magical signature with theirs. You @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.dLgAMt3TbkmLkUqE]{Ready} to use a 1-action spellshape you know on a spell your partner casts. You must specify the spellshape you plan to use. If the ally Casts a Spell that can be affected by the spellshape you chose, your partner can choose to Cast it as if they had applied the spellshape to their spell. Your partner can only apply one spellshape to a spell in this way, even if they use their own spellshape action. Your partner can also Ready a 1-action spellshape in this way for when you Cast a Spell.

On subsequent turns, you can continue to use your reactions with the same trigger as if you had used Ready or you can spend a single action with the concentrate trait to change the spellshape to another spellshape you know. Your partner can also do this on subsequent turns if they used Ready for a 1-action spellshape.

Surveyed Tracking.name: Surveyed Tracking
Surveyed Tracking.description: You have learned to hone your survey knowledge and then apply it to tracking what you find. When you get a critical failure on the @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} check from @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.tGIXuk0XeWmG04CX]{Survey Wildlife}, you get a failure instead. In addition, when you successfully Recall Knowledge on a creature with Survey Wildlife, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to Track any creatures you discover as part of your surveying for 1 day. If you are a master in Survival, the circumstance bonus increases to +3, and if you are legendary in Survival the circumstance bonus increases to +4.

The Farm Never Leaves You.name: The Farm Never Leaves You
The Farm Never Leaves You.description:
You can take the person out of the farm, but never the farm out of the person. Your experience with micro-cultures of environments, animals, and plants has given you an attunement to the world that reaches further than simple farming, allowing you to use Farming Lore to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.1OagaWtBpVXExToo]{Recall Knowledge} on environments, weather, or creatures with the animal, fungus, or plant traits.

In addition, you can spend 1 week of downtime to cultivate a farm from a plot of land, even if that land would normally be unable to provide adequate materials to farm. This allows you to cultivate a 1 square mile plot of agriculture by making a Farming Lore check to @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.actionspf2e.Item.QyzlsLrqM0EEwd7j]{Earn Income} using a task level of your level to create the farm, using the income generated for a week's work to provide any necessary materials for the farm. Once created, you and other creatures can attempt to Earn Income on the farm using a task level of your level or lower. If you choose atask level below your level, the GM may set a minimum task level for the environment if it is a particularly harsh climate for farming. As long as you successfully use Farming Lore to Earn Income on the land at least once per week, the area remains farmable by others. Creatures other than you may attempt to sustain theland for farming in your absence, but without your guidance the land requires 5 creatures to successfully Earn Income with Farming Lore to keep the farmland sustainable.

Thought Thievery.name: Thought Thievery
Thought Thievery.description:
With your signature blend of incredible thievery and obscure knowledge of the mind, you can employ tracing sigils on the side of a target's head to steal even the very thoughts within. Attempt a @Check[thievery|against:will] check against the target's Will DC. Regardless of the result, the target is then immune to Thought Thievery for 1 day.

Critical Success You rob the target of their knowledge on the subject. Choose an action or activity with the concentrate trait other than the Cast a Spell activity. For 1 minute, the target has trouble performing the action, as you have stolen their expertise, giving the action or activity a @Check[flat|dc:11]. Creatures that fail this flat check lose the actions spent on the chosen action or activity in addition to the action or activities effects.The creature can spend a single action to regain their composure and remove this effect.

Success As critical success, except it is a @Check[flat|dc:5].

Critical Failure The target puts forth enough mental defenses to repel your theft. Their mind rebukes your attempt, and you become @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.conditionitems.Item.e1XGnhKNSQIm5IXg]{Stupefied 1} until the beginning of your next turn.

Transferable Parts.name: Transferable Parts
Transferable Parts.description: You have picked up some crafting techniques allowing you to translate useful skills from what you know to similar items. When you attempt to Craft an item, you can attempt to dismantle an item of equal or lower level that shares at least 2 traits with the item you are attempting to Craft as part of your Craft activity. You reduce the cost to Craft the item by the cost to Craft the item you are dismantling, replacing the item you dismantled with the item you Craft. If the items are particularly similar, such as attempting to Craft a halberd from a guisarme or an alchemist's fire from an acid flask, you gain a +2 circumstance bonus to your check to Craft the new item.

Transitional Skills.name: Transitional Skills
Transitional Skills.description: You have drawn parallels between different types of skills in such a way that you assemble commonalities in how you operate to accentuate them. When you attempt a skill chec kwith one of your trained skills that shares its attribute with a skill you are least a master in, you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks with that skill. If you are legendary in the skill you chose you gain a +1 circumstance bonus to skill checks with expert skills that share the same attribute as your legendary skill or a +2 circumstance bonus if you are trained in that skill.

Translate Between.name: Translate Between
Translate Between.description: You act as a social glue, translating between two creatures as need be. When you attempt to Aid an ally on an action or activity that would take a penalty for not sharing a language, you can instead choose to reduce the circumstance penalty to the check for not sharing a language by 2, or by 4 if your Aid was a critical success. You must speak a language the target of the action or activity would understand or your check to Aid is automatically a failure. If you're a master in Society, you provide a +1 circumstance bonus on a successful Aid in this way, or a +2 circumstance bonus if your check was a critical success, and if you are legendary the bonus on critical success is +3 instead of +2.

Transpose Self.name: Transpose Self
Transpose Self.description:
As a byproduct of being stuck in situations less than ideal for many mages, certain magic academics created this arcane trick to allow them to cross short distances safely and allow themselves to enter areas they are otherwise incapable of doing so. Attempt an @Check[type:arcana|dc:@self.level] check against a standard DC of your level. If the distance between your starting position and ending position contains any obstacles, barriers, creatures, or difficult terrain, the DC of the check increases to a @Check[type:arcana|dc:@self.level|adjustment:+5]{very hard DC} of your level.

Success You teleport up to 15 feet to a space within your line of sight. You cannot use Transpose Self for 1 hour.

Critical Failure Your teleportation attempt fails as you suffer @Damage[@actor.level[force]] damage from your body phasing improperly. You cannot use Transpose Self for 1 day.

Trauma Team.name: Trauma Team
Trauma Team.description:
Requirements Your partner has @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.feats-srd.Item.wYerMk6F1RZb0Fwt]{Battle Medicine}.

You and your partner come to each others' aid in times of need. While employing this teamwork, when one of you is critically hit by an attack, or critically fails a save, the other may spend their reaction to Stride towards them. When one of you successfully restores Hit Points to the other using Battle Medicine, the target recovers additional Hit Points equal to your level.

Tread Where Others Cannot.name: Tread Where Others Cannot
Tread Where Others Cannot.description: You are no stranger to tough terrains, so much so that they do not phase you as they do others. You can Step into greater difficult terrain. In addition, you treat the first 5-foot square of difficult terrain when you Stride as normal terrain for the purposes of your movement.

Twin Onslaught.name: Twin Onslaught
Twin Onslaught.description:
Requirements You and your partner are both wielding the same weapon type with the twin trait.

Your complementary weapons work well together in combat. If one of you attacks with a weapon with the twin trait, the other receives the bonuses from the twin trait as if they attacked with their own twin weapon for 1 round.

Veridical Readings.name: Veridical Readings
Veridical Readings.description: The fortunes you tell are exceptionally accurate. When your GM would attempt a flat check to determine the results of a future-telling effect (such as falsely giving you a result of "nothing" on a casting of @UUID[Compendium.pf2e.spells-srd.Item.41TZEjhO6D1nWw2X]{Augury}), you reduce the DC of the flat check by 3. If you are legendary in Fortune-Telling Lore, the DC is reduced by 4.

Warrior's Rally.name: Warrior's Rally
Warrior's Rally.description:
Some forms of intimidation can inspire like that of a performance. You perform a spectacular and roaring war dance or song to boost the morale of your party. Make an @Check[type:intimidation|dc:@self.level|adjustment:5|options:action:warriors-rally] check against a very hard DC of your level by spending 1 minute rallying your allies. All allies within a @Template[type:emanation|distance:15] are affected by your Warrior's Rally for 10 minutes, or for 1 hour if you are legendary in Intimidation. Regardless of the result, allies affected by your Warrior's Rally are temporarily immune to its effects for 1 day.

Critical Success The creature gains a +2 status bonus to their next attack roll, after which the effect immediately ends.

Success As critical success, but a +1 status bonus.
